build in violation of any detailed statement of specifications or plans submitted and approved thereunder or any certificate or permit issued thereunder and from which no appeal has been taken or who shall fail to comply with such an order as affirmed or modified by the fire marshal or by a court of competent jurisdiction within the time fixed in this article shall severally for each and every such violation and noncompliance respectively be guilty of a misdemeanor punishable as provided by section 116 the imposition of one penalty for any violation shall not excuse the violation or permit it to continue and all such persons shall be required to correct or remedy such violations or defects within the time reasonably necessary as determined and specified in writing by the fire marshal or within such further time as may be extended by the fire marshal in writing and when not otherwise specified each ten days that prohibited conditions are maintained shall constitute a separate offense testing  a qualifications of testing personnel all tests shall be conducted documented and signed by a person in possession of a current fcc general radiotelephone operator license all test records shall be retained at the inspected premises by the building owner and a copy submitted to the village within 30 days of when the test has been conducted in the event the test shall fail to comply with the minimum requirements of the village appropriate modifications andor repairs shall be made and additional tests conducted until tests meet the minimum requirements of the village b testing procedure each floor of the building shall be divided into a grid of approximately 20 equal areas a maximum of two nonadjacent areas will be allowed to fail the test in the event that three of the areas fail the test in order to be more statically accurate the floor may be divided into 40 equal areas in such event a maximum of four nonadjacent areas will be allowed to fail the test after the 40 area tests if the system continues to fail the property owner shall repair replace alter or upgrade the system altered to meet the daq 3 coverage requirement talk testing from site to the village public safety communications center shall use a two watt portable transceiver with speakermicrophone and flexible antenna a spot located approximately in the center of the grid area will be selected for the test then the radio will be keyed to verify twoway communication to and from the outside of the building once the spot has been selected use of another spot with the grid area will not be permitted field strength testing instruments are to be recently calibrated within the past 12 months and of the frequency selective type incorporating a flexible antenna similar to the ones used on the hand held transceivers c gain values the gain values of all amplifiers shall be measured and the results kept on file with the property owner so that the measurements can be verified each year during the annual tests in the event that the measurement results become lost the property owner will be required to rerun the acceptance test to reestablish the gain values d acceptance testing acceptance testing for an inbuilding radio amplification system is required e annual testing when an inbuilding radio system is installed the property owner shall test all active components of the system including but not limited to amplifier the power supplies and backup batteries a minimum of once every 12 months amplifiers shall be tested to ensure that the gain is the same as it was upon initial installation and acceptance backup batteries and power supplies shall be tested under load for a period of one hour to verify that they will operate during an actual power outage all other active components shall be checked to determine that they are operating within the manufacturers specifications for the intended purpose f tenyear testing in addition to the annual test the property owner shall perform a radio coverage test a minimum of once every ten years to ensure that the radio system continues to meet the requirements of the original acceptance the procedure set forth above shall apply to such tests 5 maintenance responsibilities a maintenance contract upon completion of all the tests to the minimum standards of the village the property owner shall be responsible for the separate and distinct offense shall be considered committed every day a motor vehicle is parked or other obstructions left in the posted fire lane and provided further a separate and distinct offense and supervision over the sanitary conditions of the village including all persons and establishments handling selling manufacturing or processing any type of food within the village that are required to be inspected by this chapter and shall enforce all ordinances related thereto the term village manager in this chapter shall mean the village manager or hisher designee except as otherwise provided  432012 duties it shall be the duty of the village manager to 1 enforce and observe all rules regulations and orders of the village president and board of trustees the ordinances and regulations of the village the county department of public health and state department of public health and all state laws pertaining to the preservation of the health of the people within the village 2 exercise a general supervision over the sanitary conditions of the village including all persons and establishments handling selling manufacturing or processing any type of food 3 execute and enforce all rules regulations and orders of the board of trustees and all ordinances of the village relating to nuisances public health and sanitation 4 make or cause to be made all necessary sanitary and health investigations and inspections within the village 5 call upon the police of the village and such other authorities state or municipal as may be deemed by them to be necessary in the performance of their duties and to cause the arrest and prosecution of offenders that violate any of the ordinances of the village relating to public health and sanitation or nuisances that relate to public health or sanitation 6 furnish the village board of trustees with all such professional advice and information as they may require with a view to preservation of the public health for the purpose of carrying out such requirements the village shall be permitted at all reasonable hours during the day or night to enter into or upon any house store or other building or unimproved lot if they shall deem it necessary in order to make a thorough examination of the sanitary conditions of the premises  432012 business license required a required it shall be unlawful for any person to operate a food service establishment or retail food store within the village without a valid business license from the development department only a person who complies with the requirements of this chapter shall be entitled to receive and retain such a license a valid business license is one that is not suspended revoked or expired annual business license registration fees are as listed in section 301 1 schools with food service programs located within the village of glenview are required to obtain an annual business license but are hereby exempt from any fees as listed in section 301 b expiration business licenses shall expire on december 31 following the date of issuance permits for temporary food service establishments and temporary retail food stores shall be issued for a period of time not to exceed 14 consecutive days in conjunction with a single event or celebration c application  investigation  issuance  display 1 any person desiring to operate a food service or retail food store establishment shall make written application for a business license on forms provided by the village such application shall include the applicants full name and post office address and whether such applicant is an individual firm or corporation and if a partnership the name of the partners together with their addresses  the location and type of the proposed food service or retail food store establishment  and the signature of the applicants if the application is for a temporary food service or retail food store establishment it shall also include the inclusive dates of the proposed operation 2 upon receipt of such an application the village manager shall make an inspection of the food service or retail food service establishment to determine compliance with the provisions of this chapter when such inspection reveals that the applicable requirements of this chapter have been met a business license shall be issued to the applicant by the village manager the business license must be prominently displayed for public viewing d renewal whenever the inspection for renewal of a business license reveals serious or repeated violations of this chapter the business license will not be issued and the village manager shall notify the applicant immediately of such violations such notice shall state the reasons for not renewing the business license such notice shall also state that an opportunity for a hearing shall be provided for the applicant a business license which is not renewed and expires will be considered suspended expired business licenses shall be removed from the establishment e conditional permit when structural plumbing electrical ventilation or similar such defects exist in an established food facility that may require a significant expenditure to correct but are not considered to be an imminent health hazard a conditional permit may be granted at the discretion of the village manager under no circumstances will a conditional permit be issued for more than two consecutive sixmonth periods the purpose of the conditional permit is to allow a reasonable period of time for correction of existing defects  432012 inspections a frequency an inspection of a food service or retail food store establishment shall be performed in accordance with the frequency defined in the 2008 illinois department of public health frequency listed in the illinois department of public health based on a risk assessment which states that category 1 facilities are inspected three times a year category 2 facilities are inspected two times a year and category 3 facilities are inspected once a year additional inspections shall be performed as often as are deemed necessary for the enforcement of this chapter b access representatives of the village manager after proper identification shall be permitted to enter any food service or retail food store establishment at any reasonable time for the purpose of making inspections to determine compliance with this chapter the representatives shall be permitted to examine the records of the establishment to obtain information pertaining to food and supplies purchased received or used c school food service programs  the village manager shall make regular inspections of all school food service programs as to their hygienic and sanitary condition and shall report the result of such inspections to the board of education and to those having charge and control of such schools with instructions as to the remedy of such conditions if such be found whereby the health of those in attendance may be impaired or life endangered in the event of failure or refusal of those having such charge or control to carry out the instructions so given then the village manager shall cause such faulty conditions to be remedied at the proper cost and expense of those having charge and control of the schools d reports whenever an inspection of a food service or retail food store establishment is made the findings shall be recorded on an inspection report form the inspection report form shall summarize the requirements of this chapter and shall set forth a weighted point value for each requirement inspectional remarks shall be written to reference by item number the item violated and shall state the correction to be made the rating score of the establishment shall be the total of the weighted point values for all violations subtracted from 100 a copy of the form shall be furnished to the person in charge the completed inspection report form is a public document that shall be made available for public disclosure to any person who requests it according to law e correction of violations 1 the completed inspection report form shall specify a reasonable period for the correction of the violations found and correction of the violations shall be accomplished within the period specified in accordance with the following provisions a if an imminent health hazard exists such as complete lack of refrigeration or sewage backup into the establishment the establishment shall immediately cease food service operations operations shall not be resumed until authorized by the village manager b all violations of fourpoint or fivepoint weighted items shall be corrected as soon as possible but in any event within ten days following inspection purchase orders or work contracts with a work completion date satisfactory to the village manager may be accepted as interim corrective action a followup inspection shall be conducted to confirm correction c all onepoint or twopoint weighted items shall be corrected as soon as possible but in any event by the time of the next routine inspection d when the rating score of the establishment is less than 70 the establishment shall initiate corrective action on all identified violations within 48 hours one or more reinspections will be conducted at reasonable time intervals to assure correction e in the case of a temporary food service or special event for single day events all violations shall be corrected before food service is allowed to begin to continue in the case of multiple day events if violations are not corrected within 24 hours the establishment shall immediately cease food service operations until authorized to resume such operations by the village manager 2 the inspection report shall state that failure to comply with any time limits for corrections may result in cessation of food service operations an opportunity for hearing on the inspection findings or the time limitations or both will be provided if a written request is filed with the village manager within ten days following cessation of operations if a request for a hearing is received a hearing shall be held within 20 days of receipt of the request 3 whenever a food service or retail food store establishment is required under the provisions of subsection 1d of this section to cease operations it shall not resume operations until it is shown on reinspection that conditions responsible for the order to cease operations no longer exist the opportunity for reinspections shall be offered within a reasonable time  432012 building permit required for new work a existing establishments no food service or retail food store establishment existing on or after the effective date of the ordinance from which this chapter is derived shall continue to operate within the village unless it conforms with the requirements of this chapter  provided however that equipment and facilities installed in a food service or retail food store establishment prior to the effective date of the ordinance from which this chapter is derived which do not fully meet all of the design and construction requirements of this chapter shall be deemed or retail food store establishment or employee they shall make such investigation as may be indicated including the morbidity history of suspected employees and take appropriate action the village manager may require any or all of the following measures 1 the immediate closure of the food service or retail food store establishment concerned until in the opinion of the village manager no further danger of disease outbreak exists upon such closure the establishment may open only upon written notice from the village manager 2 the immediate exclusion of the employee from food service or retail food store establishments 3 restriction of the employees services to some area of the establishment where there would be no danger of transmitting the disease 4 adequate medical and laboratory examinations of the employee and if deemed necessary other employees  432012 examination and condemnation a samples of food and other substances may be examined or sampled by the village manager as often as may be necessary to determine freedom from adulteration and misbranding and to determine bacteriological content the village manager may request the condemnation removal destruction or denaturing of any food which is unwholesome adulterated or misbranded the village manager shall upon written notice to the owner or person in charge place a tag or hold order on any food which he determines or has probable cause to believe to be unwholesome the village manager shall permit storage of food under conditions specified in the hold order unless storage is not possible without risk to the public health in which case immediate destruction shall be ordered and accomplished it shall be unlawful for any person to remove or alter a hold order notice or tag placed on food by the village manager and neither such food or the containers thereof shall be relabeled repacked reprocessed altered disposed of or destroyed without the permission of the village manager except on order by a court of competent jurisdiction b the village manager may vacate the hold order or may by written order direct the owner or person in charge of the food which was placed under the hold order to denature or destroy such food or to bring it into compliance with the provisions of this chapter provided that such order shall be stayed if the order is appealed to a court of competent jurisdiction within three days if food is to be denatured or destroyed such action shall be taken under the supervision of the village manager  432012 sanitation standards and criteria adopted a there is hereby be kept in good repair to prevent the entrance of dirt dust insects or other vermin 2 the floors walls and ceilings of the food storage compartment of the vehicle shall be smooth and easily cleanable and shall be kept clean and in good repair 3 the use of ice as a refrigeration method shall be allowed if such use is approved by the development department such ice shall be selfdraining and the melted ice shall be contained in a permanently installed retention tank the liquid waste from the retention tank shall be disposed of as sewage 4 adequate mechanical refrigeration equipment or its equivalent shall be provided for all meat milk dairy products fish poultry and any other perishable products including meat sandwiches and cream filled pies food items shall be stored in the vehicle at a temperature not to exceed 41 degrees fahrenheit except that perishable food products commonly served as a hot food shall be stored in a heating appliance or oven equipped with a thermometer showing an internal temperature of 135 degrees or higher 5 all milk and milk products shall be served only in the individual containers or approved dispensers 6 only single service food utensils shall be used single service items are to be individually wrapped and kept in a clean and sanitary fashion protected from contamination by the customers dirt dust and flies 7 all perishable food products shall be stored as provided in this chapter or as provided by the rules and regulations established by the village manager until served to the customer 8 all individually wrapped portions of perishable food products including sandwiches pies and other similar portions shall be plainly marked by the manufacturer on the wrapper or container in such a manner as to plainly identify the day and month of which each portion was prepared and wrapped at an approved and licensed establishment the name and address of the establishment or manufacturing and wrapping portions of perishable food products shall appear on each individual portion no food product shall be offered for sale as individual portions of a perishable food product which have been rewrapped or repackaged or portions of which the identifying wrapper has been altered 9 no sale of such food or food products shall be made from mobile food units on the public rightsofway streets or other publically controlled property that may create congestion or inconvenience the public all sales of food or food products from mobile food units conducted upon private property shall have the permission of the owner of such private property to make sales from such location vendors shall obey any lawful order of a police officer to move to a different location to avoid congestion or obstruction of a public way or remove the mobile food unit entirely from the public way if necessary to avoid such congestion or obstruction 10 mobile food units shall comply with all provisions of this section section 3830 and all applicable state county and local rules and regulations  432012 restrictions on use a any signage should be attached to the mobile food unit b there shall be no bollards seating or any other equipment not person within the territorial jurisdiction of the village to a so negligently conduct any business or use any premises to create such an offensive smell as may taint the air and render it unwholesome fund shall operate under the provisions of 40 ilcs 53101 et seq as amended from time to time 18 manufactured home communities article 1  in general purpose the purpose of this chapter is to provide certain minimum standards provisions and requirements affecting or relating to the erection construction alteration remodeling repair maintenance removal and demolition of mobile home structures and to regulate said structures within the village limits  7202010 scope and applicability a this chapter is remedial and shall be construed to secure the beneficial interests and purposes thereof which are public safety health and welfare structural strength and stability adequate light and ventilation and safety to life and property from fire and hazards incidental to the construction alteration repair and maintenance of mobile home structures or portions thereof in the village except federal and state buildings and possessions b reserved c this chapter shall not be construed to prevent the enforcement of other applicable ordinances codes legislation and regulations prescribing standards other than are provided herein including but not limited to building codes fire codes property maintenance codes or water and other utility codes and in the event of conflict the most restrictive shall apply d the existing zoning ordinance set forth in chapter 98 the existing subdivision ordinance set forth in chapter 66 and the existing site plan ordinance set forth in chapter 54 and the appearance code ordinance set forth in chapter 54 and all revisions to the foregoing are hereby made a part of this chapter should a provision in these chapters or any provision in the state laws pertaining to the erection maintenance or occupancy of mobile home structures conflict with a similar provision in this chapter the most restrictive provision shall govern e this chapter applies to all mobile homes and mobile home parks located within the corporate boundaries of the village  7202010 definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this chapter shall have the meanings ascribed to them herein except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning county means cook county illinois department means the villages development department unless otherwise indicated dependent mobile home means a mobile home which does not have toilet and bath or shower facilities director means director of development front means the end of the mobile or manufactured home to which the hitch is or was attached and used for towing or for delivery to the site when a mobile home is placed in a mobile home park and the hitch is removed the department shall make a determination as to what constitutes the front immobilized manufactured home means a manufactured home served by individual utilities resting on a permanent perimeter foundation that extends below the established frost depth and with the wheels tongue and hitch removed and the home secured in compliance with the mobile home tiedown act 210 ilcs 1201 et seq independent mobile home means a mobile home which has selfcontained toilet and bath or shower facilities individual utilities means the provision for each mobile home of a separate metered connection to electrical service  separately tapped water service from an approved public water supply or a separate private water supply  and a separately tapped connection to an approved public sewer system or a separate private sewage disposal system license means a mobile home park operators license manufactured home means a structure transportable in one or more sections which in the traveling mode is eight body feet or more in width or 40 feet or more in length or when erected on site is 320 or more square feet and which is built on a permanent chassis and designed to be used as a dwelling with or without a permanent foundation when connected to the required utilities including plumbing heating air conditioning and electrical systems any structure defined in this chapter as a mobile home shall also be considered a manufactured home for purposes of this chapter the terms mobile home and manufactured home are used interchangeably this term shall not include manufactured building which shall mean any building that is of closed construction and is made or assembled in manufacturing facilities on or off the building site for installation or for assembly and installation of the building site manufactured home accessory buildings or structures is an assembly of materials forming a construction for use which contributes to the comfort convenience or necessity of the principal building or structure served including among other things awnings cabanas garages storage structures sheds decks carports fences windbreaks porches or other like appurtenances manufactured home community means a tract of land or two or more contiguous tracts of land that contain sites with the necessary utilities for five or more independent manufactured homes for permanent habitation either free of charge or for revenue purposes and shall include any building structure vehicle or enclosure used or intended for use as a part of the equipment of such manufactured home community separate ownership of contiguous tracts of land shall not preclude the tracts of land from common licensure as a manufactured home community if they are maintained and operated jointly neither an immobilized manufactured home nor a motorized recreational vehicle shall be construed as being part of a manufactured home community any community defined in this chapter as a mobile home park shall also be considered a manufactured home community for the purposes of this chapter the terms mobile home park and manufactured home community are used interchangeably mobile home means a structure designed for permanent habitation for use as a single family dwelling unit suitable for yearround occupancy and containing water supply sanitary waste disposal and electrical facilities it is so constructed as to permit its transport on wheels temporarily or permanently attached to its frame from the place of its construction to the location or subsequent locations provided that any such structure resting on a permanent foundation with wheels tongue lug bolts and hitch permanently removed shall not be construed as a mobile home mobile home park means an area of land or lands upon which one or more independent mobile homes are harbored either free of charge or for revenue purposes and shall include any building structure tent vehicle or enclosure used or intended for use as a part of the equipment of such mobile home park park operator means an owner or manager of a mobile home park their officers agents or employees permanent habitation means a period of one or more months site means the lot on which the mobile home is located for permanent habitation  7202010 secs 4344320  reserved to enter upon the premises of all mobile home parks at any time for inspection the department shall promptly bring such action as is necessary to ensure compliance with this chapter and the rules and regulations adopted pursuant thereto and to prosecute any person or persons who fail to comply with same b notices the department shall serve or cause to be served upon the licensee a written notice which shall specify the way or ways in which a licensee has failed to comply with this chapter said notice shall require the licensee to remove or abate such nuisance insanitary or objectionable condition or to otherwise bring the mobile home park into compliance with the provisions of this chapter if the licensee fails to comply with the terms and conditions of said notice within the time specified or such extended period of time the director may initiate enforcement actions c any person found to have violated any provision of this article shall be subject to a fine as set out in operating requirements each mobile home park licensed or to be constructed under the provisions of this chapter shall be operated and maintained in accordance with the requirements of this section 1 every mobile home park shall be in the charge of a responsible attendant or caretaker manager whose name address and telephone number shall be on file at all times with the department who shall maintain an office within the park and whose duty it shall be to maintain the park its facilities and equipment in a clean orderly and sanitary condition the manager along with the licensee shall be responsible for any violation of the provisions of this chapter 2 all licenses and permits to construct alter and operate the mobile home park shall be prominently displayed in the mobile home park office 3 setbacks and pad locations  accessory structures  parking  except as provided in section 4346 herein a each site on which a mobile home is located shall have a minimum area of 2500 square feet except that sites existing in parks or approved by the county or the state of illinois for construction prior to  shall contain an area of not less than 1000 square feet b no mobile home shall be located closer than five feet to the side lot lines of a mobile home park or closer than ten feet to a public street alley or building each individual site shall abut or face on a private or public driveway or roadway of not less than 24 feet in width which driveway or roadway shall have unobstructed access to a public highway or alley there shall be an open space of at least ten feet adjacent to the sides of every mobile home and at least five feet adjacent to the ends of every mobile home for mobile homes placed on a site prior to the effective date of the ordinance from which this chapter is derived c for mobile homes placed on a site after the effective date of this chapter no portion of a mobile home excluding the tongue shall be closer than ten feet side to side eight feet end to side and six feet end to end horizontally from any other mobile home or community building all manufactured home accessory buildings or structures including but not limited to garages attached and detached carports canopies porches decks or storage sheds shall be considered as part of the mobile home for the purpose of computing distances for the setback requirement parking spaces shall not however be considered part of the mobile home for the setback requirements d compliance with the setback and separation requirements shall be adhered to whenever an owner of a mobile home community enlarges or expands a concrete pad used to support a mobile home installs a new mobile home or replaces an existing mobile home on or after the effective date of the ordinance from which this chapter is derived e for new mobile home parks constructed and licensed after the effective date of the ordinance from which this chapter is derived no mobile home shall be located closer than ten feet to a private street f in the instance where an owner of a mobile home community enlarges or expands a concrete pad in an existing community used to support a mobile home installs a new mobile home in an existing community or replaces an existing mobile home in an existing community on or after the effective date of the ordinance from which this chapter is derived the mobile home shall be no closer than five feet to a public or private street the licensee may apply to the department for a variance from this setback requirement 4 utilities  drainage a all sewage and other watercarried wastes shall be disposed of into a municipal sewerage system b when a water carriage system of sewage is used each site shall be provided with a sewer connection for the combined liquid waste outlet or outlets of each mobile home it shall be the duty of the owner or operator of said park to provide an approved type of water and odor tight connection from the mobile home water drainage to the sewer connection and it shall be the duty of said owner or operator to make such connection and keep all occupied mobile homes connected to said sewer while located in the park sewer connections in unoccupied sites shall be closed such that they will emit no odors or cause a breeding place for flies no water or waste shall be allowed to fall on the ground from a mobile home c no mobile home park shall be located such that the drainage of the park area will endanger any water supply all mobile home parks shall be well drained and shall be maintained such that the area is kept free from ponds swamps and similar places in which mosquitoes may breed no wastewater shall be deposited on the surface of the ground within the mobile home park d water supply system 1 all private water supply systems and hydrants for fire safety purposes in existence prior to the date of adoption of the ordinance from which this chapter is derived shall be maintained in operable condition and good repair and it shall be the duty of the owner or operator to connect such water supply system to all occupied mobile homes while located in the park a mobile home park that does not have a private water supply and hydrants shall have an agreement approved by the village to provide an adequate and reliable water supply for fire mitigation and suppression needs this agreement shall be signed by the licensee and by the glenview village manager a copy of this agreement shall be on file at the village and posted in public view at the mobile home park site by the manager 2 a manufactured home community existing on the effective date of this chapter must provide an operating water supply system that meets the following requirements 3 a manufactured home community based water system with fire hydrants within at least every 500 feet of any structure at a minimum the hydrants within the mobile home park must be connected to a sixinch water main that generates 1000 to 1500 gallons per minute with a static pressure of 35 psi  or 4 an adequate and reliable water supply system that meets fire mitigation needs if approved by the department in consultation with the glenview fire department examples include but are not limited to the following i a mobile home park based system connected to the village of glenview water distribution system with fire hydrants strategically placed at a minimum the hydrants within the system must be connected to a sixinch water main that generates 1000 to 1500 gallons per minute with a static pressure of 35 psi  ii an onsite water reservoir  and iii fire prevention authority that has capable mobile sources such as a water tanker or fire apparatus designed with larger water tanks e an adequate supply of potable water of safe sanitary quality approved by the department and the illinois environmental protection agency shall be furnished at each mobile home park each site shall be provided with a cold water tap located in accordance with ordinances of the village f a manufactured home community constructed or developed after the effective date of this chapter must provide a mobile home park based system connected to the village of glenview water distribution system for both potable water and fire mitigation requirements 5 nuisances  garbage a a sufficient number of adequate vermin pestresistant and watertight containers in accordance with the ordinances of the village shall be supplied for the storage of garbage b grass trees and shrubbery shall be maintained in a safe sanitary and attractive condition which creates neither a nuisance nor menace to public health c garbage containers shall be emptied at least once a week and shall not be filled to overflowing or allowed to become foulsmelling or a breeding place for insects garbage and rubbish shall be disposed of in a manner which creates neither a nuisance nor a menace to health and which is approved by the department d adequate insect and rodent control measures shall be employed all buildings shall be vermin and pestresistant and rodent harborages shall not be permitted to exist in the mobile home community or pathways e no person owning keeping or harboring a dog or cat or other animal shall permit any offal fecal matter or noisome substance from such animal to remain on any public or private property in any place in the village other than the property of such owner or keeper 6 fire protection a a smoke detector and a carbon monoxide detector in working order shall be installed in every dwelling unit shall be equipped with at least one approved carbon monoxide alarm in operating condition within 15 feet of every room used for sleeping in accordance with adopted codes of the village b all areas and individual sites within the manufactured home community shall be maintained so as to be free of dry brush leaves and other debris that could contribute to the spread of fire within the site or community c the space under manufactured homes and accessory buildings and structures shall not be used for the storage of combustible materials or for the storage or placement therein of flammable liquids gases or liquid or gas fuelpowered equipment d maintenance of fire hydrants 1 the licensee shall test all fire hydrants annually to establish that they are in good working order testing requirements include turning the hydrant stem so a positive water flow is established static and residual pressure readings documented and the hydrant checked to ensure that it drains such testing documentation shall be provided to the fire department and meet the criteria established in subsection 4d1 herein during the annual test other maintenance items to be addressed shall include lubrication of the steamer andor threads and verification that each hydrant is clear and free of debris and obstructions and the bbox is clear and accessible 2 the licensee shall notify the fire department whenever a hydrants is not operable or in working condition and shall identify the nonworking hydrant in a manner acceptable to the fire department the location of these fire hydrants shall be specified in writing along with a plan to either replace the defective hydrants or restore them to working order and an anticipated date for completion a copy of such notification shall be provided to the department no more than one consecutive hydrant shall be out of service at any time 7 temporary or accessory structures a except as provided in section 4346 herein temporary porches canvasroofed canopies and skirts may be permitted for mobile homes and auxiliary rooms if in compliance with applicable local fire safety and building codes manufactured home accessory buildings or structures constructed after the date of adoption of the ordinance from which this chapter is derived may be located immediately adjacent to a sites lot line when constructed entirely of noncombustible materials provided that such buildings or structures are at least three feet from an accessory building or structure on an adjacent site and do not obstruct required exit doors or windows accessory buildings and structures constructed before the date of adoption of the ordinance from which this chapter is derived and which do not obstruct required exit doors or windows shall be permitted such structures to be permitted as nonconforming b fences are not permitted on any mobile home site 8 all streets and driveways in every mobile home park must be maintained in a passable and reasonably dustproof condition at all times a the management of every mobile home park shall assume full responsibility for maintaining in good repair and condition all sanitary and electrical appliances in the park 9 electrical hookup devices for each individual site shall be provided and the installation shall be in accordance with all state or local codes and ordinances 10 in no event shall a dependent mobile home or nonpermanent shelter or other vehicle designed or used for sleeping purposes other than an independent mobile home be permitted for occupancy at any time in a mobile park 11 community kitchens plumbing and electrical installations when mobile home community kitchens dining rooms laundries or other facilities are provided such facilities and equipment as are supplied must be maintained in a sanitary condition and punishment as provided in section 116  2 undergo medical or psychiatric treatment or treatment for drug addiction or alcoholism  3 make restitution or reparation in an amount not to exceed the actual loss or damage to property and pecuniary loss  and 4 if a minor a reside with his parent or in a foster home  b attend school  c attend a nonresidential program for youth  or d contribute to his own support at home or in a foster home 52 secs 4622546260  reserved article vi  minors curfew a by the adoption of a curfew ordinance the village is attempting to provide for the protection of minors from each other and from other persons for the reduction of juvenile criminal activity and for the protection of the public b the village board has determined that because minors under the age of 17 years possess a particular vulnerability to crime and harmful influence under certain circumstances or when not supervised or accompanied by a parent or legal guardian at night and because minors under the age of 17 years often lack the ability to make critical decisions in an informed and mature manner when exposed to nighttime influences a critical need exists for a minor curfew ordinance in the village c a curfew for those under the age of 17 years will be in the interest of the public health safety and general welfare and will assist in the protection of minors as described in subsection a of this section 64  a 4202004 curfew hours a definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this section shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this subsection except where the context clearly indicated a different meaning curfew hours means 1  pm on any sunday monday tuesday wednesday or thursday until  am of the following day  and 2  pm on any friday or saturday until  am of the following day emergency means an unforeseen combination of circumstances or the resulting state that calls for immediate action the term emergency includes but is not limited to a fire a natural disaster an automobile accident or any situation requiring immediate action to prevent serious bodily injury or loss of life establishment means any privately owned place of business operated for a profit to which the public is invited including but not limited to any place of amusement or entertainment guardian means 1 a person who under court order is the guardian of the person of a minor  or 2 an authorized person of a public or private agency with whom a minor has been placed by a court minor means any person under 17 years of age operator means any individual firm of the minor in question public place means any place to which the public or a substantial group of the public has access and includes but is not limited to streets highways and the common areas of schools hospitals apartment houses office buildings transport facilities and shops remain means to 1 linger or stay  or 2 fail to leave premises when requested to do so by a police officer or the owner operator or other person in control of the premises b offenses the following are committed offenses of curfew violation 1 a minor commits the offense of curfew violation in the event he remains in any public place or on the premises of any establishment within the village during curfew hours 2 a parent or guardian of a minor commits an offense if he knowingly permits or by insufficient control allows the minor to remain in any public place or on the premises of any establishment within the village during curfew hours 3 the owner operator or any employee of an establishment commits an offense if he knowingly allows a minor to remain upon the premises of the establishment during curfew hours c defenses 1 it is a defense to prosecution under subsection b1 and 2 of this section that the minor was a accompanied by the minors parent or a person who is named as guardian of the minor under court order or who is an authorized person of a public or private agency with whom a minor has been placed by the court  b on an errand at the direction of the minors parent or guardian without any detour or stop  c in a motor vehicle involved in interstate travel  d engaged in an employment activity or going to or returning home from an employment activity without any detour or stop  e involved in an emergency  f on the sidewalk abutting the minors residence or abutting the residence of a nextdoor neighbor if a neighbor did not complain to the police department about the minors presence  g attending a school religious or other recreational activity supervised by adults or sponsored by the village a civic organization or another similar entity that takes responsibility for the minor or going to or returning home from without any detour or stop a school religious or other recreational activity supervised by adults or sponsored by the village a civic organization or another similar entity that takes responsibility for the minor  h exercising first amendment rights protected by the united states constitution such as the free exercise of religion freedom of speech and the right to peaceably assemble  or i married or had been married or is an emancipated minor under the emancipation of mature minors act 750 ilcs 301 et seq 2 it is a defense to prosecution under subsection b3 of this section that the owner operator or employee of an establishment promptly notified the police department that a minor was present on the premises of the establishment during curfew hours and refused to leave 64  b13 4202004  ab 6152004 enforcement before taking any to the pawnbrokers license  6172008 secs 4627346290  reserved article vii  picketing definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this article shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning employee includes any employees except employees of persons who are not employers under the definition of that term in this section but shall not include any individual having authority in the interests of an employer to hire transfer suspend lay off recall promote discharge assign reward or discipline other employees or responsibly direct them or to adjust their grievances or effectively to recommend such action if in connection with the exercise of such authority is not of a merely routine or clerical nature but requires the use of independent judgment employer includes any person acting as an agent of an employer directly or indirectly but does not include any person subject to the federal railway labor act as amended from time to time nor within the jurisdiction of the national labor relations board as announced from time to time by the board labor organization means any organization of any kind or any agency or employee representation committee or plan in which employees participate and which exists for the purpose in whole or in part of dealing with employers concerning grievances labor disputes wages rates of pay hours of employment or conditions of work person includes one or more individuals labor organizations partnerships associations corporations legal representatives trustees in bankruptcy or receivers picket and picketing mean the patrolling or stationing of one or more persons about the premises being picketed upon the sidewalks and streets thereabouts to convey in oral or written form by means of banners signs placards advertisement or handbills the message of the persons picketing 65 cross reference definitions generally  12 secondary boycotts or activities it shall be unlawful for any labor organization or any officer member or agent thereof by picketing or otherwise to directly induce encourage force or require any person to reduce or cut off the transportation or delivery of any goods articles materials or commodities to an employer with which the labor organization has a primary dispute or to refuse to perform any services within the scope of his employment with an employer other than one with which the labor organization has a primary dispute 66 interference with transportation or delivery of goods performance of services and free access to premises of employer by threats and intimidation it shall be unlawful for any labor organization or any officer member or agent thereof by force threat or intimidation whether oral written or by gesture to interfere with the transportation or delivery of any goods articles materials or commodities to or the performance of any services for an employer or to restrict or curtail free access to an employers premises 67 harassment coercion or intimidation of employers and employees etc when no labor dispute exists between the employer and employees it shall be unlawful for any labor organization or any officer member or agent thereof by harassment coercion or intimidation including threats of violence or loss of business or employment or following or trailing by automobile or truck of any employer or his employees or any other person to interfere in any way with the normal business operation of any employer or the employment or work of his employees when no labor dispute exists between such employer and his employees 68 reducing or cutting off deliveries to selfemployed persons for purpose of requiring membership in labor organization by picketing it shall be unlawful for any labor organization or any officer members or agency thereof to cause deliveries to or from the premises of any selfemployed person to be reduced or cut off by means of picketing for the purpose of requiring such selfemployed person to join or pay any dues fees or other sums of money to such labor organization or to any officer member or agent thereof 69 threats gestures or intimidations causing deliveries to selfemployed persons to be reduced or cut off for purpose of requiring membership in labor organization it shall be unlawful for any labor organization or any officer member or agent thereof by oral or written statement gesture threat intimidation or force to cause deliveries to or from any premises of a selfemployed person to be reduced or cut off or free access to or from such premises to be interfered with for the purpose of requiring such selfemployed person to join or pay any dues fees or other sums of money to such labor organization or to any officer member or agent thereof 70 harassment coercion or intimidation of selfemployed persons for purpose of requiring membership in labor organization it shall be unlawful for any labor organization or any officer member or agent thereof by harassment coercion or intimidation including threats of violence or loss of business or employment or following or trailing by automobile or truck of any selfemployed person or any other person to interfere in any way with the normal business operation of any selfemployed person for the purpose of requiring such selfemployed person to join or pay any dues fees or other sums of money to such labor organization or to any officer member or agent thereof 71 representation of majority of employees required for labor dispute between employer and employees no labor dispute between an employer and his employees shall be deemed to exist for the purposes of this article where the labor organization participating or sponsoring the activity prohibited by this article does not in fact represent a majority of the employees of such employer and an objective of such activity is to obtain recognition or designation as the exclusive collective bargaining representative of such employees 72 circumstances under which labor organization does not represent a majority of employees it shall be presumed for the purposes of this article that a labor organization does not represent a majority of the employees of an employer under the following circumstances 1 where such labor organization refuses to join with the employer in requesting the department of labor of the state to administer a secret ballot election for such employees after the employer has in writing so requested of the labor organization  2 during the period of time pending such election where the labor organization and employer have jointly requested the department of labor of the state to administer a secret ballot election  and 3 for a period of 12 months after such an election is conducted if the labor organization fails to procure a majority of the votes of the employees voting in such election 73 circumstances under which labor organization does represent a majority of employees it shall be presumed for the purposes of this article that a labor organization does represent a majority of the employees of an employer under the following circumstances 1 for a period of 12 months after a secret ballot election has been administered by the department of labor of the state in which the labor organization has procured a majority of the votes of the employees voting in the election  or 2 where an employer refuses to join with such labor organization in requesting the department of labor of the state to administer a secret ballot election for such employees after the labor organization has in writing so requested of the employer 74 violations  penalties any person violating the provisions of this article shall be fined not less than $5000 nor more than $50000 for each offense and each day that such violation continues shall be deemed a separate and distinct offense 77 secs 4630246330  reserved article viii  weapons discharge no person shall fire or village to allow interior or exterior locations on public or private property to be used in film production as hereinafter defined only if the personal and property rights of affected residents and businesses can be adequately protected unreasonable and unnecessary disruptions to the community can be avoided the rights of the public to the safe and normal use of the public streets rightsofway and property can be protected the rights of the public to the orderly functioning of government and the provision of public services can be protected and hazards to the public health safety and welfare can be prevented it is the purpose of this section to establish standards for evaluating requests for the use of public or private property as a location for film production be evaluated on a casebycase basis recognizing that the nature of the film the type of production the location desired to be used the length of time of production activities and the impact of such activities on village operations and services makes each request unique a 9151998 definitions for purposes of this section the following words and phrases shall have the meanings and be constructed in accordance with the definitions set forth below film production the process of recording live action on film magnetic tape or any other medium for later sale or distribution as a movie commercial training film or educational program and any activities relating thereto including setup and site restoration film production equipment any object used in film production including but not limited to lighting equipment sound equipment cameras dressing rooms trailers props furnishings and vehicles film production permit a permit issued in accordance with the procedures and provisions of this section village manager the manager of the village of glenview illinois or his designee b 9151998 permit required no person group of persons or entities shall use any interior or exterior public or private location or property in the village of glenview for film production or place any film production equipment on any public street or rightofway on any public property or on the exterior of any private property without first having obtained a film production permit from the village in accordance with the procedures established in the section c 9151998 application and permit fees all applications for film production permits shall be accompanied by a fee as outlined by chapter 301 and determined by the police department d 9151998   6172008 submission for application for a permit all applications for a film production permit shall be submitted on a standard form prescribed by the village and to be made available in the village managers office the completed application shall be filed with the village manager no less than 30 days prior to the proposed commencement of film production the application shall be accompanied by all documentation and statements required under sections 46416 in addition the application shall provide the following information 1 the name permanent address local address and local telephone number of the applicant if the applicant is an entity the nature of the entity shall be described and proof of its current lawful existence provided 2 the name permanent address local business address permanent phone number and local phone number of the individual or individuals responsible for the daytoday operations of the film production 3 a statement that the person signing the application is authorized to do so 4 a description of the type of film production and type of film production equipment to be used 5 the proposed dates for the film production 6 the proposed hours for the film production 7 a letter or statement signed by the owner or owners and occupants of each property which the applicant proposes to use as a location for film production in the format provided in section 46417 8 the identification of the location of all public streets public ways and requested by the applicant and costs of services which in the judgment of the village manager is directly related to the film production the costs billed for such direct village labor shall be equal to one and half times the hourly rate of pay for each individual village employee so assigned including any applicable overtime plus an administrative charge equal to ten percent of such costs the village reserves the right to assign additional fire andor police personnel to the film production or film production location where in the opinion of the chief of police or fire chief such protection is warranted by the nature of the film production any expenses not incurred will be reimbursed to the applicant after the film production by the village l 9151998 use of village equipment the use of village equipment as film production equipment is prohibited m 9151998 use of village property the applicant shall agree to pay in full before film production the costs for the use of all village property and public ways the costs billed for such use of village property shall be at the rates hereinafter set forth based on the extent of interference with or disruption of the normal use and operation of village property or public way the rates for such costs shall be as follows 1 for any use of any public building the cost shall be $100000 per day any building occupied by the glenview police or fire departments cannot be used for film production 2 for the partial closure or obstruction of any public street or rightofway within any block the cost shall be $25000 per day total closure of any public street or rightofway is prohibited any expenses not incurred will be reimbursed to the applicant after the film production by the village n 9151998 processing of application the event the permit is issued in addition the chief of police fire chief and public works director shall evaluate the application on the basis of the impact of use on the public streets the impact on traffic safety and potential fire hazards the reports of the chief of police fire chief and public works director shall be forwarded to the village manager who shall determine as to whether the permit should be granted o 9151998 authority of village manager the village manager shall review the report and recommendation of the chief of police fire chief and public works director and based on all of the circumstances surrounding the film production permit application and the assessed impact of the film production shall 1 if the film production is for five days or less the village manager shall production has otherwise caused a detriment to the public health safety and welfare  3 to inspect all structures devices andor film production equipment to be used in connection with the film production at any time the film production is in process  4 to impose such regulations conditions or restrictions other than or in addition to those provided in this section as the village acting uses which are located in any singlefamily residential district except churches schools and parks and buildings and grounds associated therewith 4 to ensure adequate light air and privacy for property in the multiple dwelling business commercial planned development public lands hospital and industrial zoning districts of the village these regulations shall also apply to nonresidential uses which commercial planned development public lands hospital and industrial zoning districts of the village these regulations shall also apply to nonresidential uses which are located in any singlefamily residential district except churches schools and parks and buildings and grounds associated therewith 2 definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this article shall have the scope of powers no building or other permit otherwise required under any ordinance of the village for the erection construction alteration or repair of any building or structure in multiple dwelling business commercial planned development public lands hospital and industrial zoning districts shall be issued by the building and zoning director and no work shall be started on any elements in any of the jurisdictional areas of the appearance commission as outlined in section iii of the appearance plan as adopted by passed and approved  except upon the granting of a certificate of appropriateness by the appearance commission such requirement shall not preclude the issuance of a building permit without such certificate if the building and zoning director shall determine that no external architectural feature as defined in section 5462 is involved in the work for which the building permit is sought these regulations shall also apply to nonresidential uses which are located in any singlefamily residential district except churches schools and parks and buildings and grounds associated therewith b preliminary consideration the appearance commission shall at the written request of a prospective applicant for a certificate of appropriateness give consideration to preliminary exterior drawings sketches landscape and site plans and materials on a specific project before a formal application is filed and shall provide such advice counsel suggestions and recommendations on matters pertaining to aesthetics as they may deem necessary to guide the prospective applicant in the development of a plan which would comply with the requirements and purposes of the appearance plan except that the appearance commission shall act in an advisory capacity only with regard to preliminary plans and shall provide consultation only on projects for which preliminary drawings and materials are furnished by the prospective applicant and shall not participate in the development of the basic concept plans or drawings all hearings on preliminary plans are to be public and are to be held in accordance with the provisions and requirements provided for in subsection c of this section upon finding the preliminary exterior drawings sketches landscape and site plans and materials are appropriate to or compatible with the character of the immediate neighborhood and will tend to affect the general purposes of the appearance plan the appearance commission will issue a preliminary approval the approval will be irrevocable and makes the issuance of the certificate of appropriateness mandatory upon application unless the final presentation does not comply in all respects with the preliminary presentation upon which the preliminary approval was based c hearing coincidental with the filing of an application for a building permit or for permission to work on any elements in any of the jurisdictional areas of the appearance commission for which a certificate of appropriateness is required under subsection a of this section the applicant shall file a written application for such certificate of appropriateness on forms provided for such purpose with the office of the building and zoning director not later than seven days prior to any regularly scheduled hearing of the appearance commission for consideration by them upon such hearing the appearance commission shall consider the application for a certificate of appropriateness and if necessary receive additional evidence such as exterior elevation renderings and statements from the applicant his agent or attorney and from village personnel or other persons as to whether the external architectural features of the proposed building or structure or other improvement comply with the appearance plan at the request of any member of the appearance commission testimony given at such hearing shall be under oath d action of appearance commission if preliminary consideration has not been requested under the terms and provisions of subsection b of this section prior to making its decision the appearance commission may make recommendations to the applicant as to changes in the exterior drawings sketches landscaping site plans and materials which in the judgment of the appearance commission would tend to effect the general purposes of the appearance plan the appearance commission shall make its decision within 15 days after the hearing is closed and shall issue to the building and zoning director a certificate of appropriateness unless the appearance commission finds that the plan does not conform to the appearance plan and that the proposed building or structure will be inappropriate to or incompatible with the character of the immediate neighborhood and cause substantial depreciation in property values if preliminary hearings have been held on the project for which application is being made and preliminary approval has been issued by the appearance commission as provided in subsection b of this section the appearance commission shall issue a certificate of appropriateness immediately provided that the final drawings plans and materials as presented comply in all respects with the preliminary presentation upon which the preliminary approval was based e denial by appearance commission the appearance commission shall not deny a certificate of appropriateness except upon the concurring vote of three members f appeals all final decisions of the appearance commission under this section shall be subject to judicial review pursuant to the provisions of the
