scope  definitions a the purpose of these infill construction regulations is to provide minimum standards to insure the public health safety and welfare in so far as they are affected by infill construction projects and shall be in addition to and not a substitute for any and all other applicable regulations contained in the building infill construction regulations shall control all matters concerning construction alteration repair removal demolition and excavation activities on infill construction sites b definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this division shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning 1 infill construction shall mean shall mean any construction that will cause or result in a change in the grade or an increase in the impervious surface coverage of an area that is either i located within a residential zoning district or ii located adjacent to a lot or parcel of land that is either a within a residential zoning district or b lawfully used for residential purposes 2 infill construction site shall mean any lot or parcel of land or portion thereof upon which infill construction is to be conducted  4152008 drainage and grading of lots  earth moving a no person shall by changing the natural or existing grade of any lot tract or parcel of land alter or obstruct partially or otherwise the flow of natural drainage in a manner which wholly or partially obstructs the natural or usual flow of surface or subsurface waters or which causes or contributes or tends to contribute to temporary or permanent pooling ponding or collection of waters upon the property of another or which concentrates or intensifies the discharge of surface water upon the property of another  provided however that changes in the natural grade which would otherwise have the effect prohibited hereinabove may be permitted if the person making such change shall drain said waters by drain pipe to a connection with a village storm sewer or in any other manner as may be approved by the village engineer or their designee 1 existing drainage nuisance any surface or roof drainage which creates a structural or health hazard or any other nuisance to the owners or occupants of adjoining premises or to the public thoroughfare shall be abated by the owner of the improperly drained area drainage shall be disposed of in a manner approved by the village engineer or their designee b the applicant for a building permit the applicant involving new construction shall certify to the director of development or their designee on a form provided by the director or designee that the landscape plan for the new construction was developed with cognizance and in consideration of drainage and grading regulations of the village the certification shall also apply to persons involved in major landscaping any landscaping which would require application for and issuance of a grading permit if the design of the proposed landscaping improvements leads to a change in the grade of a lot approved drainage must be provided by way of the installation of drain pipe or other appropriate means c earth moving it shall be unlawful to move earth by creating any excavations cuts filling or otherwise which singly or in combination 1 cumulatively alters the existing natural grade by more than four inches in vertical height  or 2 alters any storm water conveyance system  or 3 cumulatively covers more than 400 square feet in area without first filing with the development department an application in writing and obtaining a grading permit therefore from said department d required plans no permit for earth moving shall be issued unless and until an application therefore shall be submitted to the development department and approved by the village engineer an application for a grading permit shall contain the following 1 grading plan a grading plan drawn to scale with all dimensions figured showing accurately the size and exact location of any contemplated excavation cut or fill including topographic detail to a level satisfactory to the village engineer 2 drainage plan a drainage plan showing methods and facilities for the control and discharge of storm water in such detail as determined satisfactory to the village engineer 3 least natural disruption facts demonstrating that the proposed earth moving plan when compared to possible alternative plans which would serve the same function shall result in the most natural appearance and the least possible disruption of natural terrain and water courses to a level satisfactory to the village engineer e the property owner or permit applicant for any building addition where the net impervious surface increases more than a net 400 square feet or any new single family residence shall engage the design civil engineer to visit the site after the completion of construction and prepare and submit to the village an asbuilt plan showing the features listed in subsections 66307d1 and 2 of this chapter as they were actually constructed the final certificate of occupancy for any building addition where the net impervious surface increases more than a net 400 square feet or any new single family home shall not be approved until the asbuilt plan is received and approved f environmental and safety precautions all persons performing any earth work under a grading permit shall put into effect all necessary safety precautions to minimize erosion protect any watercourses and other natural features including trees protect the health and welfare of all persons and protect private and public property from damage of any kind per the engineering standards manual latest revision g conditions on permit the director of development or their designee andor the village engineer may place such conditions on the time limits drainage controls safety measures and necessary site restoration associated with a grading permit as will ensure compliance with paragraph e above h persons responsible any person who shall violate any of the provisions of this section and any owner of the property upon which violations occur who has suffered or permitted such violations shall be liable therefore and shall be held subject to the remedies and penalties provided for violations of this chapter  4152008   6212011 infill construction storm water management a in addition to the requirements set forth in section 66307 of this chapter no work requiring a permit under the building be issued for any infill construction on any infill construction site without the applicant first submitting an infill construction site grading and drainage plan for review and approval by the director of development or their designee b the grading and drainage plan submitted pursuant to subsection 66308a of this chapter shall provide sufficient detail and information for storm water management on the infill construction site based upon the following standards 1 except as provided in subsection 66308b5 where the cumulative net increase in impervious surface on the infill construction site is less than 400 square feet in area the applicant shall construct and install or cause to be constructed and installed downspouts yard drains and driveway drains with unobstructed pathways to an existing storm water conveyance system located in the immediate vicinity of the infill construction site 2 except as provided in subsection 66308b5 where the cumulative net increase in impervious surface on the infill construction site is more than 400 square feet in area and in the determination of the village engineer an existing storm water conveyance system with available capacity is located in the immediate vicinity of the infill construction site the applicant shall construct and install or cause to be constructed and installed storm water drainage pipes and all related appurtenances on the infill construction site and directly connect such pipes and appurtenances including existing sump pump discharges altered as a result of the proposed improvements to the storm water conveyance system as required by subsection 66308c 3 where the cumulative net increase in impervious surface on the infill construction site is more than 400 square feet in area and in the determination of the village engineer no storm water conveyance system with available capacity is located in the immediate vicinity of the infill construction site the applicant shall construct and install or cause to be constructed and installed all necessary storm water management systems on the infill construction site including without limitation construction to offsite storm water conveyance andor detention facilities and all related appurtenances as required by subsection 66308c no offsite improvements exceeding 200 feet from any property line shall be required 4 any applicant required to construct and install offsite storm water management systems pursuant to subparagraph 66308b3 may apply for recapture fees related to the construction and installation of such offsite storm water management systems upon review and approval by the village board 5 the construction and installation requirements in subsections 66308b1 and b2 shall not apply to infill construction that consists solely of the repair or expansion of an existing or installation of a new sidewalk patio or driveway that will cause or result in a net cumulative increase in impervious surface on the infill construction site of less than 400 square feet in area provided that there are or will be upon completion of construction unobstructed pathways to an existing storm water conveyance system that is located in the immediate vicinity of the infill construction site c any and all construction and connections required pursuant to subsection 66308b that are located on public property will become public property or will connect to offsite public infrastructure shall be approved in advance by and performed to the satisfaction of the village engineer d notwithstanding anything to the contrary in this section 66308 in no event shall the grade of an infill construction site be increased without first obtaining a determination from the director of development or their designee in their sole and absolute discretion that the increased grade either 1 is necessary for the protection of the building or structure to be constructed altered or repaired on such infill construction site  or 2 will have a beneficial impact on the lots and parcels of land located adjacent to the infill construction site e any work within or adjacent to the floodplain or regulatory floodway shall comply with the villages flood control ordinance latest edition infill construction site and to any other persons or entities that the director of development or their designee determines appropriate such notice shall be in a form provided by the village and shall be given by regular first class us mail for purposes of this subsection a notice addressed to the name and address on the most recent cook county tax records shall be deemed a satisfaction of the notice requirement furthermore for purposes of this subsection a lot or parcel of land shall be deemed to abut an infill construction site if the lot or parcel of land shares a common boundary or point with the infill construction site or is separated from the infill construction site by only a public or private rightofway the applicant shall file with the village within 14 days after the filing of the permit application  written certification that such notice has been properly delivered such certification shall be in a form provided by the village the village shall not process and shall return to the applicant any permit application for which such notice was not given or for which such certification was not filed as provided in this subsection 66309a1 nothing in this subparagraph shall be deemed as prohibiting the director of development or their designee from providing notice of contemplated infill construction work that is not specifically covered or required by this subparagraph b in the event that written notice has been provided pursuant to subsection 66309a and the applicant desires to make any changes that significantly alter the amount of impervious reasonably anticipated when the final engineering plan was submitted for review and approval by the village engineer the applicant shall provide written notice of such changes in a manner conforming with subsection 66309a c prior to the commencement of any infill construction on any infill construction site that contemplates a net cumulative increase in impervious surface of less than 400 square for a permit in the same manner as provided in subsection 66309a to the owners or occupants of all lots or parcels of land that abut the infill construction site and to any other persons or entities director of development shall have the right to appeal such action but only pursuant to and in accordance with the procedures set forth in this section 66311 a general 1 an application for appeal shall be in writing and on the form provided by the office of the village engineer 2 an application for appeal shall be based on a claim that the true intent of this or the rules legally adopted under this have been incorrectly interpreted or that the provisions of this not fully apply b appeal to village management team all appeals pursuant to this section shall be filed in the office of the village engineer within 30 days after the date of the issuance or the denial of the building permit by the director of development within ten days after the village engineers receipt of a properly filed appeal the village engineer shall deliver all records and findings regarding the appeal to the village management team which shall consist of the village manager the director of development and the village engineer the village management team shall consider and decide the appeal within 30 days after receipt of the properly filed appeal the village management team may 1 affirm the decision of the director of development  or 2 overrule or modify the decision of the director of development and direct the issuance or the revocation of a previously issued building permit at the expiration of the 30 day period if the village management team has not rendered a decision on the appeal it shall be deemed that the village management team has affirmed the decision of the director of development c appeal to village board of trustees the decision of the village management team may be appealed to the village board of trustees the board the appeal shall be filed in the office of the village manager and shall be on a form provided by the office of the village manager such appeal shall be submitted in writing within 30 days after the date on which the village management teams decision is made or is deemed to have been made within ten days after the boards receipt of a properly filed appeal the village manager shall deliver all records and findings regarding the appeal to the board the board shall consider and decide such appeal at a regular or special meeting of the board within 45 days after receipt by the village manager of the properly filed appeal the board may 1 affirm the decision of the village management team  or 2 overrule or modify the decision of the village management team and direct the issuance or the revocation of a previously issued building permit at the expiration of the 45 day period if the board has not rendered a decision on the appeal it shall be deemed that the board has affirmed the decision of the village management team d successive appeals if 1 an appeal is not properly or timely filed or 2 an appeal is filed and a final decision has been rendered by the village management team or the board then no new appeal shall be allowed to be filed and no permit application shall be allowed to be resubmitted for a period of one year after the date of the director of developments decision or if applicable the village management team or boards decision except on grounds of new evidence or proof of changed conditions found to be valid by the director of development e judicial review any final decision of the board pursuant to this section shall constitute a final determination for purposes of judicial review and shall be subject to review under the illinois administrative review law 735 ilcs 53101 et seq  4152008 taxation the village at the rate of six percent of the gross room sale rental revenues from such rental leasing or letting exclusive of revenues received from food beverage and other sales for purposes of this section the term room sale rental revenues shall include only the basic room charge exclusive of meals beverages and other package items  provided however a tax shall not be levied and imposed upon any person who works and lives in the same hotel or motel  and further provided that the tax shall not be levied upon rooms rented or used by directors officers agents or employees of the owner of the hotel or motel when renting or using such rooms for or in connection with the transaction of business b the ultimate incidence of and liability for payment of such tax shall be borne by the users lessees or tenants of such rooms the tax levied in this section shall be in addition to any and all other taxes 98   2192008 payment and collection the owner manager or operator of each hotel or motel receipt or other statement or memorandum of the price charge or rent payable upon which the tax imposed in this article is computed and the amount of the tax shall be stated charged and shown immediately preceding calendar month a verified statement of admission fees or charges in a form prescribed by the finance director shall accompany each remittance acceptance by the village of any amount tendered in payment of the tax shall be without prejudice to any claim demand or right on account of any deficiency b canceled admission tickets stubs receipts and complete and accurate records collector as trustee for and on behalf of the village the failure of the tax collector to collect the tax shall not excuse or release the patron from the obligation to pay the tax d in order to permit sound fiscal planning and budgeting by the village no person shall be entitled to a refund of or credit for the tax imposed by this article unless the person files a claim for a refund or credit within one year after the date on which the tax was paid or remitted to the finance department of the village ch 10 art xv violations  penalties a it is unlawful for any person to produce present or conduct any amusement without collection of the amusement tax except as otherwise provided in this article b if the person required to collect the amusement tax fails to remit amusement to the finance department of the village within ten days after such remittance is due a penalty of ten percent of the amusement taxes due shall be assessed against such person additionally interest shall be due upon any such unpaid amusement taxes at a rate of one percent per month commencing on the first day of the month immediately following the month in which such amusement taxes were required to be remitted to the finance department of the village c any person who violates any of the provisions of this article shall upon conviction thereof be punished as provided in section 116 each fee or charge paid by a person for admission to an amusement without payment of the tax shall constitute a separate offense all fines shall be in addition to the unpaid amusement taxes plus interest and penalties the payment of a fine shall not relieve the person fined from liability for the tax provided for in this article ch 10 art xv secs 7010670120  reserved article v  municipal utility tax footnotes  5 ch 35 act 505  113 and blends thereof  1132009 local motor fuel tax imposed a a local motor fuel tax is hereby imposed on the privilege of purchasing or using in the village vehicle fuel purchased in a sale at retail commencing on  the local motor fuel tax shall be at a rate of four cents per gallon of vehicle fuel the ultimate liability for payment of the local motor fuel tax shall be upon the purchaser or user of the vehicle fuel this article shall not be construed to impose a tax upon the occupation of selling or distributing vehicle fuel it shall be a violation of this article for any retail vehicle fuel dealer to fail to add this tax to the retail price of vehicle fuel or to absorb the local motor fuel tax the local motor fuel tax shall be in addition to any and all other taxes b for purposes of this article and sections thereof using in the village shall be deemed to occur only at the locations in the village where the vehicle fuel is transferred into a vehicle or an appropriate container by which it is to be consumed or otherwise used to the extent that a person has paid the local motor fuel tax imposed herein on the retail purchase of vehicle fuel such person shall be exempt from the payment of and liability for said local motor fuel tax on the use of such fuel c it shall be presumed that all sales and uses of vehicle fuel in the village are subject to the local motor fuel tax until the contrary is established by clear and convincing evidence the burden of proving that a sale or use is not taxable under this article shall be upon the retail fuel dealer purchaser or user so claiming d the local motor fuel tax imposed by this article shall not be applicable to the privilege of purchasing or using vehicle fuel when such fuel is purchased or used as the case may be by the federal government or any of its instrumentalities  1132009   11152016 collection and remittance of local motor fuel tax a the local motor fuel tax shall be collected by each retail vehicle fuel dealer who shall have the duty to collect the local motor fuel tax in turn from the purchaser of the vehicle fuel and thereafter remit such local motor fuel tax to the village b if any retail vehicle fuel dealer fails to collect the local motor fuel tax such retail vehicle fuel dealer shall remain liable for the local fuel tax not collected and shall pay the amount of the local motor fuel tax due to the village in accordance with this article c any purchaser or user who receives or uses vehicle fuel for which the local motor fuel tax has not been collected shall pay the local motor fuel tax directly to the village by the last day of the month following the month in which such purchaser or user made the taxable purchase or use of the vehicle fuel d any person who collects the local motor fuel tax shall do so as a trustee for and on account of the village e any local motor fuel tax remittance due and owing the village shall be made to the department and shall be accompanied by any return forms as required by the department with supporting documentation such documentation shall include but will not limited to forms filed with the illinois department of revenue form st1 and worksheet st1 or such similar filing as now or hereafter required by the illinois department of revenue for the period being reported any retail vehicle fuel dealer purchaser or user who is required to remit the local motor fuel tax directly to the village on a recurring basis shall register with the department in the manner provided in this article f the local motor fuel tax return and remittance shall be submitted to the department on the 20th day of each month g failure by the retail vehicle fuel dealer to file sales and use tax returns with the illinois department of revenue shall not relieve the retail vehicle fuel dealer from the responsibility to pay the local motor fuel tax to the village h late payments of the local motor fuel tax shall be subject to such interest and penalties as may be provided in section 70407  1132009 registration of retail dealers each retail vehicle fuel dealer doing business in the village shall register with the department of the tax due for the applicable period  2 second to the interest due for the applicable period  and 3 third to the penalty for the applicable period  12192000 certain credits and refunds a the village shall not refund or credit any taxes voluntarily paid without written protest at the time of payment in the event that a locally imposed and administered tax is declared invalidly enacted or unconstitutional by a court of competent jurisdiction however a taxpayer shall not be deemed to have paid the tax voluntarily if the taxpayer lacked knowledge of the facts upon which to protest the taxes at the time of payment or if the taxpayer paid the taxes under duress b the statute of limitations on a claim for credit or refund shall be four years after the end of the calendar year in which payment in error was made the village shall not grant a credit or refund of locally imposed and administered taxes interest or penalties to a person who has not paid the amounts directly to the village c the procedure for claiming a credit or refund of locally imposed and administered taxes interest or penalties paid in error shall be as follows 1 the taxpayer shall submit to the local tax administrator in writing a claim for credit or refund together with a statement specifying a the name of the locally imposed and administered tax subject to the claim  b the tax period for the locally imposed and administered tax subject to the claim  c the date of the tax payment subject to the claim and the cancelled check or receipt for the payment  d the taxpayers recalculation accompanied by an amended or revised tax return in connection with the claim  and e a request for either a refund or a credit in connection with the claim to be applied to the amount of tax interest and penalties overpaid and as applicable related interest on the amount overpaid  provided however that there shall be no refund and only a credit given in the event the taxpayer owes any monies to the village 2 within 20 days of the receipt by the local tax administrator of any claim for a refund or credit the local tax administrator shall either a grant the claim  or b deny the claim in whole or in part together with a statement as to the reason for the denial or the partial grant and denial 3 in the event the local tax administrator grants in whole or in part a claim for refund or credit the amount of the grant for refund or credit shall bear interest at the rate of four percent per annum based on a year of 365 days and the number of days elapsed from the date of the overpayment to the date of mailing of a refund check or the grant of a credit  12192000 audit procedure any request for proposed audit pursuant to any local administered tax shall comply with the notice requirements of this article 1 each notice of audit shall contain the following information a the tax  b the time period of the audit  and c a brief description of the books and records to be made available for the auditor 2 any audit shall be conducted during normal business hours and if the date and time selected by the local tax administrator is not agreeable to the taxpayer another date and time may be requested by the taxpayer within 30 days after the originally designated audit and during normal business hours 3 the taxpayer may request an extension of time to have an audit conducted the audit shall be conducted not less than seven days nor more than 30 days from the date the notice is given unless the taxpayer and the local tax administrator agreed to some other convenient time in the event taxpayer is unable to comply with the audit on the date in question the taxpayer may request another date within the 30 days approved in writing that is convenient to the taxpayer and the local tax administrator 4 every taxpayer shall keep accurate books and records of the taxpayers business or activities including original source documents and books of entry denoting the transactions which had given rise or may have given rise to any tax liability exemption or deduction all books shall be kept in the english language and shall be subject to and available for inspection by the village 5 it is the duty and responsibility of every taxpayer to make available its books and records for inspection by the village if the taxpayer fails to provide the documents necessary for audit within the time provided the local tax administrator may issue a tax determination and assessment based on the tax administrators determination of the best estimate of the taxpayers tax liability 6 if an audit determines there has been an overpayment of a locally imposed and administered tax as a result of the audit written notice of the amount of overpayment shall be given to the taxpayer within 30 days of the villages determination of the amount of overpayment 7 in the event a tax payment was submitted to the incorrect local governmental entity the local tax administrator shall notify the local governmental entity imposing such tax  12192000 appeal a the local tax administrator shall send written notice to a taxpayer upon the local tax administrators issuance of a protestable notice of tax due a bill a claim denial or a notice of claim reduction regarding any tax the notice shall include the following information 1 the reason for the assessment  2 the amount of the tax liability proposed  3 the procedure for appealing the assessment  and 4 the obligations of the village during the audit appeal refund and collection process b a taxpayer who receives written notice from the local tax administrator of a determination of tax due or assessment may file with the local tax administrator a written protest and petition for hearing setting forth the basis of the taxpayers request for a hearing the written protest and petition for hearing must be filed with the local tax administrator within 45 days of receipt of the written notice of the tax determination and assessment c if a timely written notice and petition for hearing is filed the local tax administrator shall fix the time and place for hearing and shall give written notice to the taxpayer the hearing shall be scheduled for a date within 14 days of receipt of the written protest and petition for hearing unless the taxpayer requests a later date convenient to all parties d if a written protest and petition for hearing is not filed within the 45day period the tax determination audit or assessment shall become a final bill due and owing without further notice e upon the showing of reasonable cause by the taxpayer and the full payment of the contested tax liability along with interest accrued as of the due date of the tax the local tax administrator may reopen or extend the time for filing a written protest and petition for hearing in no event shall the time for filing a written protest and petition for hearing be reopened or extended for more than 90 days after the expiration of the 45day period  12192000 hearing a whenever a taxpayer or a tax collector has filed a timely written protest and petition for hearing under section 70429 above the local tax administrator shall conduct a hearing regarding any appeal b no continuances shall be granted except in cases where a continuance is absolutely necessary to protect the rights of the taxpayer lack of preparation shall not be grounds for a continuance any continuance granted shall not exceed 14 days c at the hearing the local tax administrator shall preside and shall hear testimony and accept any evidence relevant to the tax determination audit or assessment the strict rules of evidence applicable to judicial proceedings shall not apply d at the conclusion of the hearing the local tax administrator shall make a written determination on the basis of the evidence presented at the hearing the taxpayer or tax collector shall be provided with a copy of the written decision  12192000 interest and penalties in the event a determination has been made that a tax is due and owing assessment or other bill sent the tax must be paid within the time frame otherwise indicated 1 interest the village hereby provides for the amount of interest to be assessed on a late payment underpayment or nonpayment of the tax to be five percent per annum based on a year of 365 days and the number of days elapsed 2 late filing and payment penalties if a tax return is not filed within the time and manner provided by the controlling tax ordinance a late filing penalty of five percent of the amount of tax required to be shown as due on a return shall be imposed  and a late payment penalty of five percent of the tax due shall be imposed if no return is filed within the time or manner provided by the controlling tax ordinance and prior to the village issuing a notice of tax delinquency or notice of tax liability then a failure to file penalty shall be assessed equal to 25 percent of the total tax due for the applicable reporting period for which the return was required to be filed a late filing or payment penalty shall not apply if a failure to file penalty is imposed by the controlling ordinance  12192000 abatement the local tax administrator shall have the authority to waive or abate any late filing penalty late payment penalty or failure to file penalty if the local tax administrator shall determine reasonable cause exists for delay or failure to make a filing  12192000 installment contracts the village may enter into an installment contract with the taxpayer for the payment of taxes under the controlling tax ordinance the local tax administrator may not cancel any installment contract so entered unless the taxpayer fails to pay any amount due and owing upon written notice by the local tax administrator that the payment is 30 days delinquent the taxpayer shall have 14 working days to cure any delinquency if the taxpayer fails to cure the delinquency within the 14day period or fails to demonstrate good faith in restructuring the installment contract with the local administrator the installment contract shall be canceled without further notice to the taxpayer  12192000 statute of limitations the village local tax administrator shall review all tax returns in a prompt and timely manner and inform taxpayers of any amounts due and owing the taxpayer shall have 45 days after receiving notice of the reviewed tax returns to make any request for refund or provide any tax still due and owing 1 no determination of tax due and owing may be issued more than four years after the end of the calendar year for which the return for the applicable period was filed or for the calendar year in which the return for the applicable period was due whichever occurs later 2 if any tax return is not filed or if during any fouryear period for which a notice of tax determination or assessment may be issued by the village the tax paid was less than 75 percent of the tax due the statute of limitations shall be six years maximum after the end of the calendar year in which return for the applicable period was due or end of the calendar year in which the return for the applicable period was filed 3 no statute of limitations shall not apply if a fraudulent tax return was filed by the taxpayer  12192000 voluntary disclosure for any locally imposed and administered tax for which a taxpayer has not received a written notice of an audit investigation or assessment from the local tax administrator a taxpayer is entitled to file an application with the local tax administrator for a voluntary disclosure of the tax due a taxpayer filing a voluntary disclosure application must agree to pay the amount of tax due along with interest of one percent per month for all periods prior to the filing of the application but not more than four years before the date of filing the application a taxpayer filing a valid voluntary disclosure application may not be liable for any additional tax interest or penalty for any period before the date the application was filed however if the taxpayer incorrectly determined and underpaid the amount of tax due the taxpayer is liable for the underpaid tax along with applicable interest on the underpaid tax unless the underpayment was the result of fraud on the part of the taxpayer in which case the application shall be deemed invalid and void the payment of tax and interest must be made by no later than 90 days after the filing of the voluntary disclosure application or the date agreed to by the local tax administrator however any additional amounts owed as a result of an underpayment of tax and interest previously paid under this section must be paid within 90 days after a final determination and the exhaustion of all appeals of the additional amount owed or the date agreed to by the local tax administrator whichever is longer  12192000 publication of tax ordinances any locally administered tax ordinance shall be published via normal or standard publishing requirements the posting of a tax ordinance on the internet shall satisfy the publication requirements copies of all tax ordinances shall be made available to the public upon request at the village clerks office  12192000 internal review procedure the local tax administrator shall establish an internal review procedure regarding any liens filed against any taxpayers for unpaid taxes upon a determination by the local tax administrator that the lien is valid the lien shall remain in full force and effect if the lien is determined to be improper the local tax administrator shall 1 timely remove the lien at the villages expense  2 correct the taxpayers credit record  and 3 correct any public disclosure of the improperly imposed lien  12192000 application this article shall be liberally construed and administered to supplement all of the villages tax ordinances to the extent that any tax ordinance is in conflict with or inconsistent with this article telecommunications tax  70311 et seq  utilities ch 82 article i  in general purpose and intent the purpose and intent of this chapter is to 1 establish a local policy concerning telecommunications providers and services  2 establish clear local guidelines standards and timeframes for the exercise of local authority with respect to the regulation of telecommunications providers and services  3 promote competition in telecommunications  4 minimize unnecessary local regulation of telecommunications carriers and providers  5 encourage the provision of advanced and competitive telecommunications service on the widest possible basis to the businesses institutions and residents of the village  6 permit and manage reasonable access to the public way and other ways for telecommunication purposes on a competitively neutral basis  7 conserve the limited physical capacity of the public way held in public trust by the village  8 ensure that the villages current and ongoing regulatory costs of granting and regulating private access to and use of the public way and other ways are fully paid by the persons seeking such access and causing such costs  9 secure fair and reasonable compensation to the village for permitting private use of the public way  10 assure that all telecommunications carriers and providers providing facilities or services within the village comply with the ordinances rules and regulations of the village  11 ensure that the village can continue to fairly and responsibly protect the public health safety and welfare  12 enable the village to discharge its public trust consistent with rapidly evolving federal and state regulatory policies industry competition and technological development  13 ensure that the village is made aware of and has the opportunity to review plans for the private use of the public way and other ways in order to regulate such private use for the protection and benefit of the public health safety noncompliance providing a short and concise statement of the nature and general facts of the violation or noncompliance and providing the licensee or franchisee not less than ten days to furnish evidence that 1 corrective action has been or is being actively and expeditiously pursued to remedy the violation or noncompliance 2 rebuts the alleged violation or noncompliance 3 it would be in the public interest to impose some penalty or sanction less than revocation b if a licensee or franchisee fails to provide evidence reasonably satisfactory to the village manager as provided in subsection a of this section the village manager shall refer the violation or noncompliance to the corporate authorities the corporate authorities shall provide the licensee or franchisee with a notice and a reasonable opportunity to be heard concerning the matter c if the corporate authorities determine that a licensee or franchisee has violated or failed to comply with any of the provisions of this chapter or a franchise or license agreement the corporate authorities shall determine whether to revoke the license or franchise or to establish some lesser sanction and cure considering the nature circumstances extent and gravity of the violation as reflected by one or more of the following factors 1 whether the misconduct was egregious 2 whether substantial harm resulted 3 whether the violation was intentional 4 whether there is a history of prior violations of the same or other requirements 5 whether there is a history of overall compliance 6 whether the violation was voluntarily construction of new tcsf by encouraging couse 2 maximize and encourage the use of disguised support structures so as to ensure the architectural integrity of all areas within the village in which tcsf thereafter if the tcsf is not removed the village shall have the option to remove the tcsf 7 if the owner or operator does not file a certificate of continuing compliance within 30 days from the date of request in subsection j4 of this section it shall be conclusively presumed that the owner or operator is not in compliance with the standards and regulations of the iepa if applicable the faa fcc idol or any other agency of the state or federal government with authority to regulate tcsf 8 guyed towers are prohibited 9 human occupancy in a shelter for office or other uses or for storage of materials and equipment not in direct support of tcsf is prohibited 10 the village reserves the right to perform maintenance on any site that is owned leased licensed or otherwise controlled by the village both structural and cosmetic paint at whatever intervals may be required to assure the integrity and longevity of the site the village shall make best efforts to provide tenant with six months notification of the intended work and to temporarily relocate and continue to operate its antennas or otherwise to secure the antennas or the tcsf generally to protect them from damage tenant will be permitted to install a temporary facility necessary to keep its tcsf operational at a location approved by the governing authority which approval will not be unreasonably withheld or conditioned upon said notification tenant shall remove all of its antennas and associated cables attached to the support structure no less than 48 hours before maintenance is to begin at tenants sole cost and expense upon completion of maintenance to the support structure by the owner tenant shall reinstall all of its antennas and associated cables at its sole cost and expense further any maintenance will be conducted by owner as diligently and expeditiously as possible tenant shall have the obligation to paint its equipment including antennas and associated cables when first installed the same color and quality of paint as the support structure also the parties understand that from time to time the village will paint the support structure on which tenants facilities are installed when the village paints the support structure upon notice to tenant it may paint tenants equipment at the same time excluding its antennas and cables to insure a uniform appearance of the support structure tenant agrees to reimburse the village for owners reasonable costs for such painting directly related to the presence of tenants facility on the site 11 access to village sites is subject to checkin the siting and collocation of small wireless facilities on rightsofway within the villages jurisdiction or outside the rightsofway on property zoned by the village exclusively for commercial or industrial use in a manner that is consistent the act as defined herein b conflicts with other ordinances this article supersedes all ordinances or parts of ordinances adopted prior hereto that are in application is submitted to the village that is located within 300 feet of the new or replacement utility pole or wireless support structure and that is in the same rightofway within the used by a public safety agency for public safety communications b a wireless provider shall install small wireless facilities of the type and frequency that will not cause unacceptable interference with a public safety agencys communications equipment c unacceptable interference will be determined by and measured in accordance with industry standards and the fccs regulations addressing unacceptable interference to public safety spectrum or any other spectrum licensed by a public safety agency d if a small wireless facility causes such interference and the wireless provider has been given written notice of the interference by the public safety agency the wireless provider at its own expense shall take all reasonable steps necessary to correct and eliminate the interference a small wireless facility based on the interference described in this b6 if the wireless provider is not making a good faith effort to remedy the problem in a manner consistent with the abatement and includes transit lodging retail and wholesale establishments or places engaged in selling merchandise or rendering services industrialgovernmental user includes schools hospitals churches and users associated with federal state and local governments industrial user includes establishments engaged in manufacturing activities involving the mechanical or chemical transformation of materials or substances into products residential user means all dwelling units such as houses mobile homes apartments and permanent multifamily dwellings wastewater means the spent water of a community which may be a combination of the liquid and watercarried wastes from the residences commercial buildings industrial plants and institutions together with any groundwater surface water and stormwater that may be present wastewater facilities means the structures equipment and processes required to collect carry away and treat domestic and industrial wastes and transport effluent to a watercourse wastewater service charge means the charge per billing period levied on all users of the wastewater facilities wastewater treatment works means an arrangement of devices and structures for treating wastewater industrial wastes and sludge such term is sometimes used as synonymous with the term waste treatment plant or pollution control plant watercourse means a channel in which a flow of water occurs either continuously or intermittently water quality standards has the meaning as defined in the water pollution regulations of the state 46 cross reference definitions generally  12 damage to sewer system no the wastewater discharge to assure that compliance with the federal state and local standards are being met the owner shall report the results of measurements and laboratory analyses to the village at characteristics of waters and wastes to which reference is made in this article shall be determined in accordance with the latest edition of standard methods for the examination of water and wastewater published by the american public health association the american water works association and the water environment federation and shall be determined at the control manhole provided or upon suitable samples taken at such control manhole if no special manhole has been required the control manhole shall be considered to be the nearest downstream manhole in the public sewer to the point at which the building sewer is connected sampling shall be carried out by customarily accepted methods to reflect the effect of constituents upon the sewage works and to determine the existence of hazards to life limb and property the particular analyses involved will determine whether a 24hour composite of all outfalls of a premises is appropriate or whether a grab sample should be taken normally but not always bod and suspended solids analyses are obtained from 24hour composites of all outfalls whereas phs are determined from periodic grab samples  special agreements and arrangements constructed to as near a uniform grade and in as direct line to sewer connections as practical such pipe and fittings must have a clean and smooth interior and shall be the full area of its respective size pipe and fittings shall be put together with a flexible type coupling similar to the band seal or equal each length of pipe and each fitting shall have solid bedding of granular material or other solid and imperishable material under the full length thereof a onefourth bend shall not be used no fittings or bend shall be used to change the direction of the line of drainage unless such fitting or bend shall be of a radius of not less than 12 inches connection of one line of drainage with another shall be made where at all practical with full y branches the use of t connections is prohibited change in direction of any line of drainage shall not be made by the use of mitered pieces of straight pipe but shall be made by the use of an approved fitting of the required angle the interior of each joint of pipe or fitting laid shall be swabbed out before another joint is made no clay or tile pipe or fittings shall be constructed inside or under any building for drainage purposes having an outlet to any sewer all building sewers run to receive drainage of any kind from buildings shall terminate five feet outside the foundation walls of such building no tile house sewer shall at any time be laid closer than five feet to any wall foundation or footing except at or nearly perpendicular to the wall or footing if it should become necessary to place such building sewer closer to any such wall foundation or footing or under any area wall or pier such building sewer shall be constructed of extra heavy cast iron pipe as for a building drain 60 separate storm sewer systems all newly constructed commercial industrial and multifamily buildings shall be provided with a separate storm sewer system for roof and surface drainage singlefamily residential construction should discharge and storm sewer drains may be laid side by side in one trench 61 obstructions to building sewers should water gas or other pipes or drains be encountered in the direct line of a building sewer during capacity to receive the building sewage and wastes for not less than 24 hours b the soil or vent pipe leading to an ejector or other appliance for raising sewage or other waste matter to the public undertake an inspection of all fire hydrants on private property on water lines connected to the village water system for the purpose of ascertaining whether such fire hydrants are in proper working order b it shall be the responsibility of the owner of any fire hydrant located on private property to 1 maintain such fire hydrants in proper working order as established by the department of public works  2 notify the fire department that a fire hydrant is not working  3 repair such fire hydrants promptly  4 maintain the area around each fire hydrant free from obstructions  5 permit the department of public works and fire department to inspect such fire hydrants as needed  and 6 allow the village to repair a fire hydrant when in the judgment of the fire department the immediate repair is necessary to protect the public health safety and welfare c property owners will be notified of any fire hydrant found inoperative or in poor working order by the village director of public works owners of such fire hydrants shall be given written notice by the director of public works that the broken fire hydrant must be repaired within five days the fire hydrant owner may choose to request that the village water department repair the fire hydrant and should notify the village of such choice within the fiveday period failure to so notify the village within the fiveday period may result in the village water department performing the repairs on a time and material basis in addition the property owner shall be subject to a fine of $20000 if the village is not notified within the fiveday period as forth in this subsection routine maintenance may be performed by village employees  fire hydrant rules and specifications the department of public works may establish rules and specifications for the physical characteristics of fire hydrants which may include the color of the hydrants clear distance and height  fire hydrant maintenance and repairs the village shall on a yearly basis perform routine maintenance of fire hydrants at no charge to the property owner the maintenance shall include inspection painting flushing and any minor repair any other repairs shall be billed to the owner of such hydrant on a time and material basis  refusal to allow fire hydrant inspection or maintenance when a property owner fails or refuses to allow fire hydrant inspection andor maintenance by an authorized representative of the village as provided in this division andor to notify the village as provided in section 82197 the village may then repair the fire hydrant and charge the property owner on a time and material basis in addition the property owner shall be subject to a fine of $20000 for failing or refusing to allow inspection andor maintenance of the fire hydrant as provided for in this section  violations  penalties a any person who violates any of the provisions of this division shall upon conviction be subject to section 116 each day that a violation of the provisions of this division exists or occurs shall constitute a separate violation for which a separate fine or other penalty may be imposed b in addition to being subject to a fine any person who violates any of the provisions of this division may be subject to injunctive relief to enjoin the continuance of such violation c in addition to being subject to a fine any person violating any provision of this division shall be subject to the shutoff of water service to the property of such person whereon the violation exists until such time as the violation has been corrected such shutoff of water service shall be accomplished in accordance with the notice and hearing requirements set forth in section 82194 d any property owner found to have reconnected the source of clear water inflow into the sanitary sewer system after having been required to disconnect such source shall be subject to the maximum penalty of $75000 per day with each day constituting a separate violation and the shut off of water service according to the hearing requirement set forth in section 82194  secs 8220282230  reserved article iii  waterworks and sewerage system division 1  generally findings  operation a it is hereby found determined and declared necessary for the best interests of the village that the existing waterworks system and sanitary sewerage system of the village be combined into a single utility to be known and designated as the combined waterworks and sewerage system of the village of glenview b all property real personal and mixed comprising the waterworks system and sanitary sewerage system of the village as described in subsection a of this section is hereby found determined and declared to constitute the properties of the combined waterworks and sewerage system of the village c from and after the effective date of the ordinance from which this article is derived such existing waterworks system and sanitary sewerage system shall be owned and operated by the village as a combined utility to be known as the combined waterworks and sewerage system of the village and all improvements and extensions to such waterworks andor sewerage system shall be considered as improvements and extensions to such combined utility and all the properties assets obligations and liabilities of all kinds of such waterworks system and sanitary sewerage system existing outstanding and accruing or to accrue shall be held used confessed and acknowledged as the properties assets obligations and liabilities of such combined utility d the village waterworks and sewerage system shall be operated as part of the department of public works except as otherwise provided in this article the director of public works shall direct all operations of the waterworks and sewerage system and shall exercise control and management thereof 1 application for water service  payments  fixtures  procedure for plan approval construction inspection and acceptance of mains and extensions a no water shall be supplied to any building structure or premises in the village from the waterworks system nor shall any person be permitted to tap any main or make any connection with any supply pipe or service pipe for the purpose of furnishing any water to any building structure or premises or for any other purpose until an application in writing shall first have been made to the director of public works by the person desiring such building structure or premises to be supplied with water or desiring to tap any such main or make connection with such service pipe or supply pipe such application shall set out the full name and address of the applicant and shall state fully all purposes for which a water supply is desired or for which it is desired to tap such water main or make connection with such service pipe or supply pipe and the number of feet of frontage and depth of the lot included in the premises to be serviced and provided further that any deposits or payments required to be made have been made by the applicant thereupon such applicant shall be permitted to have water supplied to his building structure or premises from the waterworks system and to tap any such water main or make connections with any such service pipe or supply pipe as requested in such application and in accordance with the direction of the director of public works and under his supervision and to his satisfaction and approval provided that the tapping of any water main shall be done only by a tapper who is an employee or is duly authorized by the village b should the village install any water main for the purpose of extending the village waterworks system wherein water fund revenues are used any applicant whose building structure or premises directly benefits from such main extension shall pay with such application a pro rated share of the cost of construction and engineering in accordance with a recapture ordinance on file with the village manager such payment shall be in addition to any other connection tapping or meter fees in force at the time of application c all plumbing fixtures installed within the village water service area whether inside or outside of the village corporate limits must be water saving fixtures in conformance with the requirements of the village plumbing code d should the applicant install any water main or extension for the purpose of connecting to the village waterworks system the procedure for plan approval construction inspection and acceptance of such mains or extensions will conform to the following 1 the system shall be constructed in such a manner to provide each lot with a separate connection the water mains shall extend to the extremities of the applicants property and shall be designed and constructed in conformance with the requirements of the state environmental protection agency and the village 2 prior to review of the plans and specifications by the village a cash review fee of one percent of the estimated construction costs of the required mains will be paid to the village 3 a performance bond approved by the village manager shall be posted only in cash sufficient to cover estimated construction expenditures of the required main or extension if a contract exists the performance bond shall be 100 percent of the contract and ten percent for contingencies in the absence of a contract the estimate of the applicants engineer shall be used which shall include ten percent for contingencies in addition to the bond the applicant will post with the village four percent of the first $5000000 of construction costs and three percent of the construction costs above $5000000 to cover the cost of inspection services by the village such cash shall be posted only after the plans and specifications have been approved by the village engineer and before a construction permit is issued during the period that such cash shall remain on deposit with the village the village shall have the right and authority to deposit or invest the amount thereof in depositories or securities authorized by law and to retain for its own use and benefit all interest and income therefrom 4 all main extension plans costs and estimates shall be checked and approved by the village engineer and all improvements shall be inspected by him during and after completion of all construction the applicants engineer with the approval of the village engineer may make alterations and corrections where such are required to conform to existing field conditions changes from original plans shall only be approved when accompanied by an adjustment in the cash deposit changes where made shall be shown on the original working drawings as revisions and noted asbuilt and signed and sealed by the subdividers engineer before the completed improvements are accepted by the board of trustees the applicant shall file one sepia copy of asbuilt working drawings together with a duly executed bill of sale in satisfactory form granting transferring and conveying to the village with proper warranty free of any claims of encumbrances good title to the water main or extensions and any and all easements required by the village for maintenance and repair of such mains 5 payments from the cash escrow account shall be made periodically upon the certification of the applicants engineer to the contractor constructing the improvement upon final payment to the contractor any remaining balance shall be refunded to the applicant 6 if the applicant fails to complete the construction in accordance with the requirements of this article within two years of the date of the cash deposit agreement the cash deposit shall be forfeited and the village shall use all or such part of such deposit as may be required to complete the project in accordance with the approved working drawings the twoyear time limit may be extended by the village when to do so is in the public interest in the event of such forfeiture the applicant shall only be entitled to the refund of that portion if any of the cash deposit that remains in escrow after completion of the project 2 water service pipes supplying two or more premises no service pipe shall be laid or used to supply water to two or more distinct premises or buildings unless separate stopcocks for each of the premises or buildings shall be placed in the parkway outside of such premises as provided in this article and a permit fee shall be charged for each service 10 water service pipes for automatic sprinkler systems water pipes entering premises and used for fire protection only and connected with automatic sprinkler devices shall be supplied from a separate pipe having an independent connection with the main and shall be and shall be constructed so as to permit in the case of necessity an uninterrupted flow of water 11 testing of sprinkler systems whenever the owner of a sprinkler system desires to make a test thereof prevent the waste of water by reason of defective pipes or stopcocks  and in case any portion thereof shall be in a leaky or defective condition such person shall be notified by the director of public works either in person or in writing of such leaky or defective condition  and if the leak or defective condition is not repaired within 30 days after such notice the water supply shall be shut off its own expense when such leaks occur between the water main and the buffalo or shutoff box and shall thaw frozen service pipes between the water main and the buffalo or shutoff box when it shall be water from the responsibility of replacing the service pipe between the water main and the buffalo or shutoff box if notified in writing by the director of public works that such portion of such service pipe is defective and in need of replacement  nor shall such person be relieved of the obligation or expense of lowering a shallow service pipe between the water main and the buffalo or shutoff box to prevent repeated freezing of such service pipe if upon receipt of written notice from the director of public works to lower or replace a service pipe between the water main and the water for any of the following purposes during such emergency period 1 sprinkling  2 car washing  3 air conditioning or cooling  4 commercial or industrial uses beyond requirements for sanitation or preserving health  5 any other use that is not directly connected with the preservation of health sanitation safety or public welfare 43 sprinkling restrictions a from may 15 lawn sprinkling shall not
