user charge rate shall be computed as follows 1 the projected annual revenue required to operate and maintain the sanitary sewer system for the year including a replacement fund will be determined 2 the volume of wasterwater expected to flow system will be estimated 3 the cost per 1000 gallons of flow system will be computed d review and revision the sanitary sewer user charge shall be reviewed annually and revised as necessary to reflect any change in operation maintenance and replacement e measurement of flow the volume of flow used for computing the total user charge shall be metered water consumption read to the lowest even increments of 1000 gallons  provided however that 1 the measurement of flow of any person discharging wastes into the sanitary sewer system who procures any part or all of his water from sources other than the village water supply system all or part of which is discharged into the sanitary sewer system shall be estimated on a per capita consumption basis 2 water used for yard sprinkling if measured by a separate irrigation meter shall be exempt from the sewer user charge the irrigation meter must be installed in a manner deemed appropriate by the village the cost of installation maintenance and replacement of such irrigation meter shall be borne by the property owner f corated the rates to be charged for sanitary sewer service are detailed in section 82372  revenues a all revenues and moneys derived from the operation of the sewerage system shall be deposited in the sewerage account of the sewerage fund all such revenues and moneys shall be held by the finance director separate and apart from all other funds of the village b the finance director shall receive all such revenues from the sewerage system and all other funds and moneys incident to the operation of such system as they may be delivered to him and he shall deposit such amounts in the account of the fund designated as the sanitary sewer enterprise fund of the village the finance director shall administer such funds in every respect in the manner provided by statute  accounts  audit the finance director shall establish a proper system of accounts and shall keep proper books records and accounts in which complete and correct entries shall be made of all transactions relative to the sewerage system and at regular annual intervals he shall cause to an audit by an independent auditing concern to be made of the books to show the receipts and disbursements of the sewerage fund the financial information to be shown in the audit report shall include the following 1 billing data to show the total number of gallons billed 2 debt service for the next succeeding fiscal year 3 number of users connected to the system  access to books documents papers and records the state environmental protection agency or its authorized representative shall have access to any books documents papers and records of the village which are applicable to the village system or user charges for the purpose of making audits examinations excerpts and transcriptions thereof to ensure compliance with the terms of the special and general conditions of any state grant  secs 8238182400  reserved division 7  cross connection control definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this division shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning agency means the state environmental protection agency approved means backflow prevention devices methods or installations approved by the village based on the research foundation for cross connection control of the university of southern california american water works association american national standards institute or american society of sanitary engineering or certified by the national sanitation foundation auxiliary water system means a source of water outside of the villages public water supply system no connection to the villages public water supply system shall be made with any other water system without the approval of the local authority backflow means the flow of water or other liquids mixtures or substances into the distribution pipes of a potable water system from any source other than the intended source of the potable water supply backflow prevention device means any device method or type of construction intended to prevent backflow into a potable water system all devices used for backflow prevention in the state must meet the standards of the state plumbing code and the state environmental protection agency consumer and customer mean the owner official custodian or person in control of any premises supplied by or in any manner connected to a public water system consumers or customers water system means any water system serving the premises commencing at the outlet side of the service pipe shutoff valve location as stated in this division contamination means the introduction into water of microorganisms chemicals wastes or wastewater in a concentration that makes water unfit for its intended use cross connection means any connection a supply of potable water could be contaminated or polluted double check valve assembly means an assembly composed of single independently acting check valves including the shutoff valves located at each end of the assembly and suitable connections for testing the water tightness of each check valve fixed air gap means the unobstructed vertical distance free atmosphere between the water discharge point and the flood level rim of the receptacle health hazard means any condition device or practice in a water system or its operation resulting from a real or potential danger to the health and wellbeing of consumers the term severe as used to qualify the term health hazard means a hazard to the health of the user that could be expected to result in death or significant reduction in the quality of life inspection means a plumbing inspection to carefully and critically examine all materials fixtures piping and appurtenances appliances and installations of a plumbing system for compliance with requirements of the state plumbing code 77 ill admin local authority means the village president and board of trustees and their duly authorized agents nonpotable water means water not safe for drinking personal use or culinary use as determined by the requirements of 35 ill admin plumbing means the actual installation repair maintenance alteration or extension of a plumbing system by any person such term includes all piping fixtures appurtenances and appliances for a supply of water for all purposes including without limitation lawn sprinkler systems from the source of a private water supply on the premises or from the main in the street alley or at the curb to within and about any building where persons live work or assemble such term includes all piping from the discharge of the pumping unit to and including pressure tanks in water supply systems such term includes all piping fixtures appurtenances and appliances for a building drain and a sanitary drainage and related ventilation system of any building where persons live work or assemble from the point of connection of such building drain to the building sewer or private sewage disposal system five feet beyond the foundation walls pollution means the presence of any foreign substance organic inorganic radiological or biological in water that tends to degrade its quality so as to constitute a hazard or impair the usefulness of the water potable water means water which meets the requirements of 35 ill admin for drinking culinary and domestic purposes potential cross connection means a fixture or appurtenance with a threaded hose connection tampered spout or other connection which would facilitate extension of the water supply line beyond its legal termination point process fluid means any fluid or solution which may be chemically biologically or otherwise contaminated or polluted in a form or concentration such as would constitute a health pollutional or system hazard if introduced into the public or a consumers potable water system including but not limited to 1 polluted or contaminated waters  2 process waters  3 used waters originating from the public water supply system which may have deteriorated in sanitary quality  4 cooling waters  5 questionable or contaminated natural waters taken from wells lakes streams or irrigation systems  6 chemicals in solution or suspension  7 oils gases acids alkalis and other liquid and gaseous fluids used in industrial or other processes or for firefighting purposes public water supply system means all mains pipes and structures owned andor maintained by the village water is obtained and distributed to the public including wells and well structures treatment plants reservoirs storage tanks and appurtenances collectively or severally actually used or intended for use for the purpose of furnishing potable water reduced pressure zone principle backflow prevention device rpz means a device containing a minimum of two independently acting check valves together with an automatically operating pressure differential relief valve located between the two check valves during normal flow and at the cessation of normal flow the pressure between the two check valves shall be less than the supply pressure in case of leakage of either check valve the differential relief valve by discharging to the atmosphere shall operate to maintain the pressure between the check valves at less than the supply pressure the unit must include tightly closing shutoff valves located at each end of the device and each device shall be fitted with properly located test cocks service connection means the physical connection to the water main including all fittings and appurtenances water is supplied to the consumer survey means the collection of information pertaining to a customers piping system regarding the location of all connections to the public water supply system and must include the location type and most recent inspection and testing date of all cross connection control devices and methods located within the customers piping system the survey shall be completed on a form supplied by the village ch 21 art viii  a cross reference definitions generally  12 general policy a purpose the purpose of the rules and regulations set forth in this division are to 1 protect the public water supply system from contamination or pollution by isolating within the customers water system contaminants or pollutants which could backflow service connection into the public water supply system 2 promote the elimination or control of existing cross connections actual or potential between the public or consumers potable water system and nonpotable water systems plumbing fixtures and sources or systems containing substances of unknown or questionable quality 3 provide for the maintenance of a continuing program of cross connection control which will prevent the contamination or pollution of the public and consumers potable water systems b application the rules and regulations set forth in this division shall apply to all premises served by the public potable water supply system of the village ch 21 art viii  b prohibited connections a no person shall establish or maintain or permit to be established or maintained any connection whereby a private auxiliary or emergency water supply other than the regular public water supply of the village may enter the supply or distribution system of such municipality unless such private auxiliary or emergency water supply and the method of connection and use of such supply shall have been approved in writing by the director of public works andor plumbing inspectors and the state environmental protection agency b no connection shall be permitted between the public water supply system and any other water supply not of equal or better bacteriological and chemical quality as determined by inspection and analysis by the agency andor the village c there shall be no arrangement or connection by which contamination may enter the public water supply system ch 21 art viii  c surveys and investigations a it shall be the duty of the director of public works to cause surveys and investigations to be made of industrial and other properties and premises served by the public water supply to determine whether actual or potential hazards to the public water supply may exist such surveys and investigations shall be made a matter of public record and shall be repeated as often as the director of public works shall deem necessary records of such surveys shall be maintained and available for review for a period of at least five years b the consumers premises shall be open at all reasonable times to the certified cross connection control device inspector or his duly authorized agent cccdi for the inspection of the presence or absence of cross connections within the consumers premises and testing repair and maintenance of cross connection control devices within the consumers premises c on request by the director of public works or his authorized representatives the consumer shall furnish information regarding the piping system for water use within the consumers premises and cross connection inspection results the consumers premises shall be open at all reasonable times to the director of public works andor his duly authorized agent for the verification of information submitted by the consumer regarding the piping system for water use and cross connection inspection results d it shall be the responsibility of the water consumer to arrange periodic surveys of water use practices on the consumers premises to determine whether there are actual or potential cross connections to the consumers water system contamination or pollution could backflow into the consumers or the public potable water system all cross connection controls or other plumbing inspections must be conducted in accordance with 225 ilcs 32031 e it is the responsibility and financial obligation of the water consumer to prevent backflow into the public water supply system by ensuring that 1 all cross connections are removed or approved cross connection control devices are installed for control of backflow and backsiphonage 2 cross connection control devices are installed in accordance with the manufacturers instructions 3 cross connection control devices are inspected at least annually by a cccdi the inspection of mechanical devices shall include physical testing in accordance with the manufacturers instructions 4 testing and recording is accomplished as follows a each device shall be tested at least annually or more frequently if recommended by the manufacturer or director of public works b records submitted to the director of public works shall be available for inspection by agency personnel in accordance with 415 ilcs 54e c each device shall have a tag attached listing the date of the most recent test name of the cccdi and type and date of repairs 5 a maintenance log is maintained which shall include the following a date of each test  b name and approval number of the person performing the inspection or test  c test resultsinspection  d repairs or servicing required  e repairs and dates completed  and f services performed and dates completed ch 21 art viii  d backflow prevention devices a an approved backflow prevention device shall be installed on each water service line to a consumers water system when in the judgment of the director of public works or his authorized representative based upon state environmental protection agency regulations an actual or potential hazard to the public water supply system may exist b an approved backflow prevention device shall be installed on each water service line to a consumers water system where the following conditions exist 1 a premises having an auxiliary water system unless such auxiliary water system is accepted as an additional source by the director of public works and the source is approved by the agency and local authority 2 a premises where any substance exists which can create an actual or potential hazard to the public water supply system 3 a premises having internal cross connections that in the judgment of the director of public works are not correctable or intricate plumbing arrangements which make it impractical to determine whether or not cross connections exist 4 a premises where because of security requirements or other prohibitions or restrictions it is impossible or impractical to make a complete cross connection survey 5 a premises having a repeated history of cross connections being established or reestablished c an approved backflow prevention device shall be installed on each water line to a consumers water system serving but not necessarily limited to the following types of facilities unless the director of public works determines that no actual or potential hazard to the public water supply system exists 1 hospitals mortuaries clinics or nursing homes 2 laboratories 3 sewage treatment plants sewage pumping stations or stormwater pumping stations 4 food or beverage processing plants 5 chemical plants 6 metal plating industries 7 petroleum processing or storage plants 8 radioactive material processing plants or nuclear reactors 9 carwashes 10 all commercial retail and industrial accounts all water services larger than two inches all irrigation lines and all fire sprinkler lines d where a booster pump has been installed on the service line to or within any premises such pump shall be equipped with a low pressure cutoff device designed to shut off the booster pump when the pressure in the service line on the suction side of the pump drops to 20 pounds per square inch psi or less e it shall be the duty of the water consumer to maintain the low pressure cutoff device in proper working order and to certify to the director of public works at least once a year that the device is operable ch 21 art viii  e type of protection required a the type of protection required shall depend on the degree of hazard which exists as follows 1 an approved fix air gap shall be installed where the public water supply system may be contaminated causing a severe health hazard 2 an approved fixed air gap or an approved reduced pressure zone principle backflow prevention device shall be installed where the public water supply system may be contaminated causing a system or health hazard 3 an approved fixed proper air gap separation or an approved reduced pressure zone principle backflow prevention device shall be installed where the public water supply system may be polluted with substances that could cause a pollution hazard not dangerous to health b the type of protection required under section 82405 shall be an approved fixed proper air gap separation or an approved reduced pressure principle backflow prevention device c where a public water supply or an auxiliary water supply is used for a fire protection system reduced pressure principle backflow preventors shall be installed between the fire sprinkler systems connected to the public water supply system when 1 the sprinkler system contains antifreeze andor chemical additives  2 water may be pumped into the system from another source and can be connected to the sprinkler system ch 21 art viii  f approval required all backflow prevention devices methods installations and maintenance required by this division shall be approved by the village based on the research foundation for cross connection control of the university of southern california american water works association american society of sanitary engineering or american national standards institute or certified by the national sanitation foundation to be in compliance with applicable industry specifications the manufacturers maintenance manual shall be available onsite ch 21 art viii  g inspection and maintenance a it shall be the duty of the consumer at the premises on which backflow prevention devices required by this division are installed to have inspections tests maintenance and repairs made in accordance with the following schedule or more often where inspections indicate a need or are specified in the manufacturers instructions 1 fixed proper air gap separations shall be inspected at the time of installation and at least annually thereafter 2 double check valve assemblies shall be inspected and tested for tightness at the time of installation and at least annually thereafter and required service performed within 15 days 3 reduced pressure principle backflow prevention devices shall be tested at least annually or more frequently if recommended by the manufacturer b testing shall be performed by a person who has been approved by the agency as competent to service the device proof of such approval shall be in writing c each device shall have a tag attached including the information required in sections 82404e4c and 82404e5 d whenever backflow prevention devices required by this division are found to be defective they shall be repaired or replaced at the expense of the consumer within 15 days or as specified by the director of public works e backflow prevention devices shall not be bypassed made inoperative removed or otherwise made ineffective without specific authorization by the director of public works f copies of all test results shall be forwarded to the director of public works at the time of each inspection as described in section 82404 ch 21 art viii  h corrective actions nothing in this division shall prevent the village from taking such other action as it deems necessary to prevent or remedy a violation of this article ch 21 art viii  i violations  penalties a the director of public works may deny or discontinue after ten days prior written notice to the occupants thereof the water service to any premises wherein any backflow prevention device required by this division is not installed tested maintained and repaired in a manner acceptable to the director of public works or if it is found that the backflow prevention device has been removed or bypassed or if an unprotected cross connection exists on the premises or if a low pressure cutoff required by this division is not installed and maintained in working order b in the case of an identified cross connection the director of public works or his duly authorized representative shall take immediate action to terminate the potable supply of water to the premises without notice  provided however that written notice shall be given to the owner or occupant of the premises as soon as practicable under the circumstances as exist at the time such water service to the premises is terminated c water service to such premises shall not be restored until the consumer has corrected or eliminated such conditions or defects in conformance with this division and to the satisfaction of the director of public works and the required reconnection fee is paid d any person charged with a violation of this division who shall be found guilty by a court of competent jurisdiction shall be deemed to have committed a petty offense and shall be fined as provided in section 116 each day a violation occurs shall be deemed a separate offense ch 21 art viii  j vegetation 66236  zoning ch 98 article i  in general secs 8618630  reserved article ii  trees division 1  generally purpose the regulation of trees by this article supplemented by the tree standards manual is intended to accomplish the protection preservation replacement planting and maintenance of trees within the village and the following related goals 1 protect and enhance the quality of life and the general welfare of the village and its residents and conserve and enhance the villages physical and aesthetic environment by a reducing energy consumption by providing summer shade and blocking winter wind  b providing a buffer and screen against noise and light pollution  and c reducing air pollution removal of carbon dioxide generation of oxygen and the precipitation of dust and other airborne pollutants 2 protect and increase property values in a manner that maintains each property owners enjoyment of hisher property 3 recognize historic significance and maintain the natural heritage of the community 4 protect and enhance our natural environment by a providing habitat and food that are essential for wildlife including migratory and nesting birds to sustain them and the many benefits they provide including control of insects b stabilizing topsoil by preventing or minimizing soil erosion and sedimentation c controlling stormwater runoff detention and absorption of water 5 eliminate trees that constitute a threat danger or nuisance to the public or property in the village or that may be dangerous to the health of other trees and vegetation in the village 6 protect and restore to the greatest extent possible denuded soil that results from construction and grading work and protect existing healthy trees during the course of development 7 ensure diversity of tree species within individual neighborhoods and the village of glenview as a whole 8 utilize best efforts to ensure an aesthetically pleasing landscape design and maintain neighborhood characteristics 1   162015 forth in this section  or 3 waive any of the other regulations of this section or this article b notwithstanding any other regulations of this article if a tree emergency occurs the person endangered by the tree emergency may take any reasonable action necessary to avoid or eliminate the immediate danger or hazard the action taken shall be an action that is least likely under the circumstances to cause damage or removal of any tree and the village assumes no responsibility or liability for any such action taken the person taking such action shall document the reasons for the tree emergency by zelkova and planera that are affected with fungus ceratostomella ulmi as determined by the director of public works are hereby declared to be illegal and shall be removed and disposed of within 30 days following notification of the discovery of such infection it shall be unlawful for any person who owns property on which such a tree is situated to possess or keep such tree after the expiration of 15 days following notification of the discovery of the infection b trees or parts thereof that are infected by the european elm bark beetle scolytus multistraitus are declared to be illegal it shall be unlawful for the person owning property whereon such infected trees or parts thereof are situated to possess or keep such infected trees or parts thereof c trees or parts thereof that are infected by the asian long horned beetle or the asian cerambycid beetle anoplophora glabripennis are declared to be illegal it shall be unlawful for the person owning property whereon such infected trees or parts thereof are situated to possess or keep such infected trees or parts thereof 41   162015 abatement a the village manager or designee shall give to the owner of the premises where the nuisances described in this division are found a written notice of the existence of such tree requiring the removal and lawful disposal of such tree within ten days following such notice such removal and disposal shall be done under the direction and supervision of the village manager or designee the notice shall also notify the owner of such premises that unless such tree is removed in compliance with the terms thereof within such tenday period the village will proceed with the removal and disposal of such tree and assess the cost thereof against the property owner b service of the notice shall be by personal service or certified mail addressed to the owner at his last known address c upon service of such notice it shall become the duty of the owner of the premises to cause such tree or breeding place to be removed and lawfully disposed of under the direction and supervision of the village manager or designee if the village shall remove and dispose of any tree or breeding place all expenses incurred in connection therewith shall be assessed against the property owner 42   162015 lien for abatement costs a whenever billing for the removal or abatement of a nuisance tree under ilcs 511702 overtaking and passing vehicles on the left the following rules shall govern the overtaking and passing of vehicles proceeding in the same direction subject to those limitations exceptions and special rules otherwise stated in this chapter 1 the driver of a vehicle overtaking another vehicle proceeding in the same direction shall pass to the left thereof at a safe distance and shall not again drive to the right side of the roadway until safely clear of the overtaken vehicle  2 except when overtaking and passing on the right is permitted the driver of the overtaken vehicle shall give vehicle may not in passing upon the left of any vehicle proceeding in the same direction pass upon the right of any other vehicle proceeding in the same direction unless there is an unobstructed lane of traffic available to safely permit such passing maneuver  state law reference similar provisions 625 ilcs 511703 overtaking and passing vehicles on the right a the driver of a vehicle with three or reserved division 4  accidents duties of drivers a the driver of any vehicle involved in a motor vehicle accident resulting in personal injury to or death of any person shall immediately stop such vehicle at the scene of such accident or as close thereto as possible and shall then forthwith return to and in every event shall remain at the scene of the accident until the requirements of section 11403 have been fulfilled every such stop shall be made without obstructing traffic more than is necessary b any person who has failed to stop or comply with the requirements of subsection a of this section shall as soon as possible but in no case later than one hour after such motor vehicle accident or if hospitalized and incapacitated from reporting at any time during such period as soon as possible but in no case later than one hour after being discharged from the hospital report the place of the accident the date the approximate time the drivers name and address the registration number of the vehicle driven and the names of all other occupants of such vehicle at a police station or sheriffs office near the place where such accident occurred no report made as required under this subsection shall be used directly or indirectly as a basis for the prosecution of any violation of subsection a of this section for purposes of this subsection the term personal injury shall mean any injury requiring immediate professional treatment in a medical facility or doctors office c the driver of any vehicle involved in a motor vehicle accident resulting only in damage to a vehicle which is driven or attended by any person shall immediately stop such vehicle at the scene of such motor vehicle accident or as close thereto as possible but shall forthwith return to and in every event shall remain at the scene of such motor vehicle accident until the requirements of subsection d of this section have been fulfilled every such stop shall be made without obstructing traffic more than is necessary d the driver of any vehicle involved in a motor vehicle accident resulting in injury to or death of any person or damage to any vehicle which is driven or attended by any person shall give the drivers name address registration number and owner of the vehicle the driver is operating and shall upon request and if available exhibit such drivers license to the person struck or the driver or occupant of or person attending any vehicle collided with and shall render to any person injured in such accident reasonable assistance including the carrying or the making of arrangements for the carrying of such person to a physician surgeon or hospital for medical or surgical treatment if it is apparent that such treatment is necessary or if such carrying is requested by the injured person if none of the persons entitled to information pursuant to this subsection is in a condition to receive and understand such information and no police officer is present such driver after rendering reasonable assistance shall forthwith report such motor vehicle accident at the nearest office of a duly authorized police authority disclosing the information required by this subsection e the driver of any vehicle which collides with or is involved in a motor vehicle accident with any vehicle which is unattended or other property resulting in any damage to such other vehicle or property shall immediately stop and shall then and there either locate and notify the operator or owner of such vehicle or other property of the drivers name address registration number and owner of the vehicle the driver was operating or shall attach securely in a conspicuous place on or in the vehicle or other property struck a written notice giving the drivers name address registration number and owner of the vehicle the driver was driving and shall without unnecessary delay notify the nearest office of a duly authorized police authority and shall make a written report of such accident length of roadway  definitionsoversize and overweight vehicles for purposes of the following definitions apply 1 a oneway or single trip movement means one move from the point of origin to the point of destination any additional stops between the point of origin and the point of destination are expressly prohibited single trip permits are effective for five consecutive days from the date of issuance unless otherwise directed by the traffic unit 2 round trip movement means two trips over the same route in opposite directions round trip permits over a circular or roundabout route will not routinely be issued unless different return routing is necessary due to lower clearance or a deficiency in a structure in the opposite directions 3 multiple moves are those in such close proximity to each other in distance or in time that the traffic unit would consider incorporating two or more permit moves as one move multiple move permits when granted by the traffic unit shall be for a period of time not to exceed 30 days from the date of issuance multiple moves must be identified prior to obtaining a permit 4 limited continuous use movements are movements generally to one site over a period of three months made by overdimension oversized vehicles which do not exceed the weight limits defined in 625 illinois compiled statutes act 5 limited continuous use permits may be issued for up to ten trips generally to the same site during the time period allowed each move must be verified by the traffic unit prior to making the move due to possible lane closures requiring a route change requirements when any traffic is allowed zones and when the movement is made by applicants not performing construction on the roadway closed in an emergency declared by resolution of the village board the requirements to obtain permits may be waived exempt from permits are the following 1 fire department vehicles 2 those vehicles operating under an emergency declaration 3 village owned vehicles engaged in emergency utility repair 4 equipment used for snow and ice removal owned or operated by any government body b permits shall be issued only in the name of a person firm business or corporation that owns and operates the transporting vehicle or that operates the vehicle under a bona fide lease agreement c permits for vehicles that are both overweight and overdimensional are valid only a half hour before sunrise to a half hour after sunset on any day which the permit is valid d permits are nontransferable and apply only to the permittee e the village may issue revisions to permits 1 to correct an error attributed to the village 2 to correct an error attributed to the applicant discovered before the move 3 to adjust weights dimensions or routes as issued on the permit before the move is made 4 any revision made at the request of the permittee for purposes of changing weights dimensions routes or load descriptions shall be made before any move is made at a cost of $1000 per permit f the permit when issued constitutes an agreement between the permittee and the village that the move described in the application will take place only as described the permittee has the responsibility to report to the villages police department traffic unit any inaccuracies or errors on the part of either the village or the permittee before starting any move undertaking the move is prima facie evidence of acceptance of the permit as issued and its terms g the routing prescribed in the permit constitutes the sole extent of the authority granted by the permit for the use of village roads and any vehicle andor load found to be off route will be considered off route and without a permit permits shall be in the drivers possession at all times unless otherwise directed by the traffic unit and presented upon demand to any and all police officers for the purpose of inspection h if required arrangements shall be made by the permittee to have the proper utilities notified property moved bridges or highways analyses performed and completed in advance of any permit movement i all movements under the permit shall be made in accordance with all applicable federal state and local laws ordinances rules and regulations j permits are void if altered for the purpose of deception the permits issued under this section constitute the grant of a privilege by the village and may be denied or suspended for such reasons as the village may deem rationally related to its governmental interests including but not limited to 1 a permittee knowingly providing incorrect information in an applicant for a permit 2 a permittee its agents or employees acting on a permit which has been altered for purposes of deception 3 noncompliance by permittee its agents or employees with federal state or local ordinances pertaining to the transport of goods or operation of a vehicle engaged in the transport of goods 4 moving on village streets without a valid permit as required under this article v  inoperable or abandoned vehicles definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this article shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning abandoned vehicle means any vehicle which is left at any location for a period of 14 days or more and under such circumstances as to cause such vehicle to reasonably appear to have been abandoned inoperable motor vehicle means any motor vehicle from which for a period of at least 14 days the engine wheels or other parts have been removed or altered damaged or otherwise treated so that the vehicle is incapable of being driven under its own motor power such term shall not include a 1 motor vehicle which has been rendered temporarily incapable of being driven under its own power in order to perform ordinary service or repair operations  2 motor vehicle which is kept within a building when not in use  3 historic vehicle over 25 years of age  or 4 motor vehicle on the premises of a place of business engaged in wrecking or junking of motor vehicles not more than one currently unregistered or unlicensed vehicle shall be kept parked or stored on any premises at any time except as set forth in this definition property means any real property within the village which is not a street or highway vehicle means a machine propelled by power other than human power designed to travel along the ground by use of wheels treads runners or slides and transport persons or property or pull machinery and shall include without limitation automobiles trucks trailers motorcycles tractors buggies and wagons  cross reference definitions generally  12 state law reference similar provisions 625 ilcs 511403 abandonment of vehicles no person shall abandon any vehicle within the village nor leave any vehicle at any place within the village for such a time and under such circumstances as to cause such vehicle to reasonably appear to have been abandoned  leaving inoperable motor vehicle on street or highway no person shall leave for a period of more than 12 hours on any street or highway in the village any vehicle which is in such a state of disrepair as to be incapable of being driven under its own motor power  inoperable motor vehicles declared a nuisance inoperable motor vehicles whether on public or private property are hereby declared to be a nuisance  cross reference nuisances  38281 et seq disposition of inoperable motor vehicles all persons are required to dispose of any inoperable motor vehicle under their control upon written notice received from the corporate authorities or the chief of police or any member of his department designated by him commanding such disposition of such inoperable motor vehicle  removal and impoundment the chief of police or any member of the police department designated by him is hereby authorized to remove or have removed any vehicle left at any place within the village which reasonably appears to be in violation of this article or which reasonably appears to be lost stolen or unclaimed or which is an inoperable motor vehicle such vehicle shall be impounded until lawfully claimed or disposed of in accordance with 625 ilcs 5420154213  violations  penalties any person violating any of the provisions of this article shall be deemed guilty of a misdemeanor and upon conviction shall be fined in an amount not exceeding $50000 each day such violation is committed or permitted to continue shall constitute a separate offense and shall be punishable as such under this section  secs 9036890400  reserved article vi  motorcycles operation a a person operating a motorcycle shall ride only upon the permanent and regular seat attached thereto and such operator shall not carry any other person nor shall any other person ride on a motorcycle unless such motorcycle is designed to carry more than one person in which event a passenger may ride upon the permanent and regular seat if such seat is designed for two persons or upon another seat firmly attached to the motorcycle at the rear or side of the operator b a person shall ride upon a motorcycle only while sitting astride the seat facing forward with one leg on each side of the motorcycle c no person shall operate any motorcycle with handlebars higher than the height of the shoulders of the operator when the operator is seated in the normal driving position astride that portion of the seat or saddle occupied by the operator  state law reference similar provisions 625 ilcs 5111403 eye protection devices a definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this section shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this subsection except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning glasses means ordinary eye pieces such as spectacles or sunglasses worn before the eye made of shatterresistant material the term shatterresistant material as used in this subsection means material manufactured fabricated or created so that it substantially prevents shattering or flying when struck or broken goggles means a device worn before the eyes the predominant function of which is protecting the eyes without obstructing peripheral vision goggles shall provide protection from the front and sides and may or may not form a complete seal with the face transparent shield means a windshield attached to the front of a motorcycle that extends above the eyes when an operator is seated in the normal upright riding position made of shatterresistant material or a shatterresistant protective face shield that covers the wearers eyes and face at least to a point approximately to the tip of the nose b operators the operator of a motorcycle motordriven cycle or motorized pedalcycle and every passenger thereon shall be protected by glasses goggles or a transparent shield contact lenses are not acceptable eye protection devices  state law reference similar provisions 625 ilcs 5111404 handlebars no motorcycle may be operated with handlebars rising more than 15 inches in height above the level of the seat or saddle  secs 9040490430  reserved article vii  bicycles registration and tag a every person residing within the village who owns possesses or regularly operates within the village limits a bicycle with a wheel dominator of over 20 inches shall obtain from the chief of police a registration tag for each bicycle so owned possessed or regularly used a fee as established from time to time by resolution of the president and board of trustees shall be charged for issuing such registration tag a registration tag may be transferred to another bicycle owned by a registrant without additional charge only upon proof that the original bicycle is no longer owned possessed used or offered for rent within the village limits by the original registrant thereof and the bicycle to which the registration tag is to be transferred complies with the provisions of this article b upon the receipt of the fees for such registration the chief of police shall accept the bicycle for registration and issue a registration tag bearing an identifying number and attach the tag to the bicycle which meets the equipment standards for bicycles as set forth and published by the chief of police from time to time the chief of police may require any bicycle to be reinspected from time to time c no bicycle rental agency operating within the village limits shall rent or offer for rent any bicycle unless the bicycle is registered and a registration tag is attached thereto as provided in this section and such bicycle is equipped as required by this article d the chief of police shall maintain such records as are necessary to carry out the requirements of this section e the chief of police may from time to time authorize such persons as in his opinion are necessary to perform the work necessary to carry out the requirements of this section  lamps and other equipment a every bicycle when in use at nighttime shall be equipped with a lamp on the front which shall emit a white light visible from a distance of at least 500 feet to the front and with a red reflector on the rear of a type approved by the state department of transportation which shall be visible from all distances from 100600 feet to the rear when directly in front of lawful lower beams of headlamps on a motor vehicle a lamp emitting a red light visible from a distance of 500 feet to the rear may be used in addition to the red reflector b a bicycle shall not be equipped with nor shall any person use upon a bicycle any siren c every bicycle shall be equipped with a brake which will adequately control movement of and stop and hold such bicycle d no person shall sell a new bicycle or pedal for use on a bicycle that is not equipped with a reflex reflector conforming to specifications prescribed by the state department of transportation on each pedal visible from the front and rear of the bicycle during darkness from a distance of 200 feet e no person shall sell or offer for sale a new bicycle that is not equipped with side reflectors such reflectors shall be visible from each side of the bicycle from a distance of 500 feet and shall be essentially colorless or red to the rear of the center of the bicycle and essentially colorless or amber to the front of the center of the bicycle the requirements of this subsection may be met by reflective materials which shall be at least threesixteenths of an inch wide on each side of each tire or rim to indicate as clearly as possible the continuous circular shape and size of the tires or rims of such bicycle and which reflective materials may be of the same color on both the front and rear tire or rim such reflectors shall conform to specifications prescribed by the state department of transportation f no person shall sell or offer for sale a new bicycle that is not equipped with an essentially colorless frontfacing reflector g all bicycles shall have such other equipment as the chief of police may from time to time reasonably determine to be necessary for the safe operation of any bicycle  provided however a list of such equipment is published by the chief of police as provided in section 90431b   state law reference similar provisions 625 ilcs 5111507 operating regulations a the operator of any bicycle within the village shall in addition to the other provisions of this article conform to the provisions of the illinois vehicle ilcs 51100 et seq b no person shall ride a bicycle except upon or astride the regular permanent seat attached thereto c no person shall carry upon a bicycle more persons than the number for which such bicycle has been designed and is properly equipped to carry except that an adult rider may carry a child securely attached to his person in a backpack or sling d no person shall operate a bicycle at a speed faster or in any manner other than that which is reasonable and prudent with regard to the safety of the riders thereof and others using the roadway e no person shall ride a bicycle without having at least one hand on the handlebar or other steering device at all times f all bicycles shall be operated as near to the righthand curb as conditions will permit exercising due care when passing a standing vehicle or a vehicle proceeding in the same direction g no person riding upon a bicycle coaster roller skates sled or toy vehicle shall attach such bicycle coaster roller skates sled or toy vehicle or himself to any other moving vehicle h the operator of a bicycle on a roadway when making a right turn shall follow the righthand lane next to the righthand edge of the roadway no operator of a bicycle shall suddenly start slow down stop or attempt to turn without first giving the standard signal required by state law for motor vehicles under the same circumstances i no bicycle shall have attached to it any other vehicle such as a wagon or sled j no person shall ride a bicycle on any sidewalk or roadway on which the chief of police by sign has posted as bicycles prohibited k whenever a person is riding a bicycle upon a sidewalk such person shall yield the rightofway to any pedestrian and shall give audible signal before overtaking and passing such person l no bicycle shall be left lying upon any street sidewalk or alley or in such a position as to obstruct or interfere with the use of any street sidewalk or alley m proper hand signals should be used at all times by a bicycle operator n every person operating a bicycle must obey all traffic signs  state law reference similar provisions 625 ilcs 5111503 5111504 violations  penalties any person convicted of a violation of any provision of this article shall be punished by a fine of not less than $100 nor more than $10000 for each offense or have his bicycle impounded for a period not to exceed 120 days  secs 9043590460  reserved article viii  pedestrians obedience to traffic control devices and traffic regulations a a pedestrian shall obey the instructions of any official traffic control device specifically applicable to him unless otherwise directed by a police officer b pedestrians shall be subject to traffic and pedestrian control signals as provided in 625 ilcs 511306 and 511307 but at all other places pedestrians shall be accorded the privileges and shall be subject to the restrictions stated in this article  state law reference similar provisions 625 ilcs 5111001 rightofway at crosswalks a when traffic control signals are not in place or operation the driver of a vehicle shall yield the rightofway slowing down or stopping if need be to so yield to a pedestrian crossing the roadway within a crosswalk when the pedestrian is upon the half of the roadway upon which the vehicle is traveling or when the pedestrian is approaching so closely from the opposite half of the roadway as to be in danger b no pedestrian shall suddenly leave a curb or other place of safety and walk or run into the path of a moving vehicle which is so close as to constitute an immediate hazard c a of this section shall not apply under the condition stated in 625 ilcs 5111003b d whenever any vehicle is stopped at a marked or unmarked crosswalk at an intersection to permit a pedestrian to cross the roadway the driver of any other vehicle approaching from the rear shall not overtake and pass such stopped vehicle e whenever stop signs or flashing red signals are in place at an intersection or plainly marked crosswalk between intersections drivers shall yield the rightofway to pedestrians as set forth in 625 ilcs 511904  state law reference similar provisions 625 ilcs 5111002 crossing at other than crosswalks a every pedestrian crossing a roadway at any point other than within a marked or unmarked crosswalk at an intersection shall yield the rightofway to all vehicles upon the roadway b any pedestrian crossing a roadway at a point where a pedestrian tunnel or overhead pedestrian crossing has been provided shall yield the rightofway to all vehicles upon the roadway c between any intersections whenever the board of trustees of the village shall determine upon the basis of a traffic investigation upon any roadway under its jurisdiction that crossing between intersections should be prohibited in the interest of public safety pedestrians shall not cross at any place except in a marked or unmarked crosswalk at an intersection and that such prohibition shall be effective when appropriate signs giving notice thereof are erected d notwithstanding the provisions of this section every driver of a vehicle shall exercise due care to avoid colliding with any pedestrian upon any roadway and shall give warning by sounding the horn when necessary and shall exercise proper precaution upon observing any child or confused or incapacitated person upon a roadway  state law reference similar provisions 625 ilcs 5111003 visibly disabled pedestrians the driver of a vehicle shall yield the rightofway to any pedestrian with clearly visible disabilities  state law reference similar provisions 625 ilcs 5111004 soliciting rides no person shall stand in a roadway for the purpose of soliciting a ride from the driver of any vehicle  state law reference similar provisions 625 ilcs 5111006a walking on highways a where a sidewalk is provided and its use is practicable it shall be unlawful for any pedestrian to walk along and upon an adjacent roadway b where a sidewalk is not available any pedestrian walking along and upon a highway shall walk only on a shoulder as far as practicable from the edge of the roadway c where neither a sidewalk nor a shoulder is available any pedestrian walking along and upon a highway shall walk as near as practicable to an outside edge of a roadway and if on a twoway roadway shall walk only on the left side of the roadway d except as otherwise provided in this chapter any pedestrian upon a roadway shall yield the rightofway to all vehicles upon the roadway  state law reference similar provisions 625 ilcs 5111007 secs 9046790500  reserved article ix  shopping center traffic contract to regulate traffic the corporate authorities of the village and any shopping center owner located within the village may by contract empower the village to regulate the parking of automobiles and traffic at such shopping center such contract shall empower the village to accomplish all or any part of the following 1 erection of stop signs flashing signals or yield signs at specified locations in a parking area and the adoption of appropriate regulations pertaining thereto or the designation of any intersection in the parking area as a stop intersection or yield intersection and the ordering of like signs or signals at one or more entrances to such intersection subject to the provisions of this article 2 prohibition or regulation of the turning of vehicles or specified types of vehicles at intersections or other designated locations in the parking area 3 regulation of the crossing of any roadway in the parking area by pedestrians 4 designation of any separate roadway in the parking area for oneway traffic 5 establishment and regulation of loading zones 6 prohibition regulation restriction or limitation of the stopping standing or parking of vehicles in specified areas of the parking area 7 designation of safety zones in the parking area and fire lanes 8 providing for the removal and storage of vehicles parked or abandoned where they constitute an obstruction to traffic and for the payment of reasonable charges as may be established from time to time by resolution of the president and board of trustees of the village for such removal and storage by the owner or operator of any such vehicle 9 providing that the cost of planning installation and maintenance of parking and traffic regulations pursuant to any contract entered into under the authority of this article shall be borne by the property or shopping center owner and the cost for the enforcement thereof shall be borne by the village 10 contracting for such additional reasonable rules and regulations not inconsistent with this article with respect to traffic and parking in a parking area as local conditions may require for the safety and convenience of the public or the users of the parking area  contract approval contracts entered into pursuant to this article must be approved by the board of trustees signed by the president and attested to by the clerk  contract term no contract entered into between the village and any shopping center owner pursuant to this article shall exceed a period of 20 years no lessee of a shopping center shall enter into such a contract for a longer period of time than the length of his lease  contract recording any contract entered into between the village and any shopping center owner pursuant to this article shall be recorded in the office of the recorder of deeds of the county and no regulation made pursuant to the contract shall be effective or enforceable until three days after the contract is recorded and the posting of signs indicating such regulation in the shopping center  violations  penalties at such time as parking and traffic regulations have been established at any shopping center pursuant to the contract as provided for in this article it shall then be an offense for any person to do any act forbidden or to fail to perform any act required by such parking or traffic regulation and such violation is punishable by a fine of not less than $100 nor more than $20000  secs 9050690540  reserved article x  schedules stop intersections in accordance with section 90141 and when signs are licenses required by this chapter shall be made upon forms furnished by the village b application fees the annual fee for all licenses under this chapter shall be established by the annual fee ordinance all fees shall be prorated if the license is issued for a partial license year c general application requirements all applications for any license under this chapter shall contain at a minimum the following information 1 the full name address and telephone number of the applicant 2 where the applicant is not an individual the form and state of organization ie corporation partnership and the name title and telephone number of the contact person for the applicant 3 whether the applicant has previously received licenses under this chapter d additional requirements for chauffeurs license all applications for chauffeurs licenses under this chapter shall demonstrate compliance with all of the following requirements 1 that the applicant is at least 18 years of age 2 that the applicant is not afflicted with any infirmity of body or mind which may render him or her unfit for safe operation of a public passenger vehicle as evidenced by presentation of a the results of a medical examination including tests for drug and alcohol consumption that was conducted by a licensed physician not more than 13 months in advance of the date of application and b the results of tests for drug and alcohol consumption that was conducted by a licensed physician not more than 90 days in advance of the date of application 3 that the applicant has a valid illinois drivers license 4 that the applicant has not been convicted of a class a misdemeanor or felony charge within the last five years or show a previous background that indicates a tendency to act in a manner that may place the public at risk 5 that the applicants drivers or chauffeurs license has not been suspended or revoked in any state within the last three years for any violation of law concerning the operation of a motor vehicle other than a single failure to comply with emissions testing requirements 6 that the applicant has had no more than two convictions for violation of traffic regulations governing the movement of vehicles within one year prior to the date of application 7 that the applicant has never caused unlawful operation of a motor vehicle an accident resulting in the death of any person 8 that the applicant is able to understand communicate read write and speak the english language at a level of expertise sufficient to effectively function as a public passenger vehicle operator the applicant must pass a written examination that tests the applicants knowledge of the english language local geography and traffic laws no applicant may take the examination more than four times in any 180 day period 9 photograph and fingerprints may be taken of all applicants and shall be required every other year the village manager may after completion of a background check and investigation waive some or all of the requirements of this subsection based upon the demonstration that the applicants driving habits are not careless or reckless and that a responsible driving record has been maintained for at least five years preceding the date of application e additional requirements for livery vehicle and taxicab licenses application for a livery vehicle or taxicab license shall be made by the owner of the vehicle upon forms furnished by the village such application shall identify the vehicle owner and contain a complete description of the vehicle or taxicab including make model year color state registration number vehicle identification number livery or taxicab company name company assigned vehicle number copy of vehicle registration card and copy of document containing evidence of required insurance the application shall also include a copy of the vehicle inspection form from the vehicle testing station f additional requirements for taxicab service operators and livery vehicle service operators licenses application for a taxicab service operators license or a livery vehicle service operators license shall be made by the owner or person with legal control over taxicabs or livery vehicles operating within the village such application shall identify all vehicles proposed for use in service in the village including the status of licensure of such vehicles shall identify all drivers of such vehicles including the status of all village chauffeurs licenses for such persons and shall include a schedule of rates for various services offered the application shall also provide the legal relationship of the applicant to such listed vehicles and drivers  9212004 term issuance display and transfer of licenses a all licenses provided for under this chapter of the vehicle for which it is issued d it shall be unlawful to transfer any license issued under this chapter from one person or vehicle to another e any person issued a chauffeurs license must inform the village within ten days after any change of name address or phone number  9212004 renewal a chauffeurs license any person requesting that a chauffeurs license be renewed shall submit an application to the village prior to the date of expiration of the chauffeurs license no chauffeurs license shall be renewed until after the village has conducted a review of the renewal applicants driving record and criminal background no chauffeurs license will be renewed unless the village manager determines that the applicant for renewal continues to meet the requirements for receiving a chauffeurs license b vehicle licenses any person requesting that a vehicle license for a vehicle licensed under this chapter be renewed shall submit an application to the village prior to the date of expiration of the vehicle license no vehicle license will be renewed unless the village manager determines that the vehicle continues to meet the vehicle license requirements c operators licenses any
